title: Innovation Scientist I
description:
Job Summary
We are IFF. We are the catalyst for discoveries that spark the senses and transform the everyday. International Flavors & Fragrances Inc. is a leading innovator of sensorial experiences that move the world. At the heart of our company, we are fueled by a sense of discovery, constantly asking, “what if?”  

  

That passion for exploration drives us to create unique scents and tastes in fine fragrances and beauty, detergents and household goods, as well as beverages, confectionary and food products.  

  

Our global team members take advantage of leading consumer insights, research and development, creative expertise, and customer intimacy to develop differentiated products. Dreamers and doers, we work tirelessly to discover flavors and fragrances that inspire customers and delight consumers. We are fueled by our four corporate values; passion, creativity, expertise and empowerment. It is the unique blend of these values that make us IFF. The Company leverages its competitive advantages of brand understanding and consumer insight combined with its focus on R&D and innovation, to provide customers with differentiated product solutions.  

The Role  

As a Scientist within the Scent Technology and Innovation team, you will work together with R&D, Perfumers, Operations and Commercial teams to create and deliver innovative technologies. You will be responsible for understanding how these technologies interact with fragrances ingredients and customers formulations in order to design and deliver fragrance solutions which will delight our consumers. You will be part of the Fabric Care team located in Hilversum and will share our knowledge and learning with other teams globally.  

Major Responsibilities Include* Drive, Plan, Conduct & Report laboratory work for Innovation projects
* Develop and present technical information to support project decision making in order to deliver truly differentiated solutions
* Work with R&D, Perfumers, Evaluators and Operation teams to identify and understand the challenges and risks
* Design, prepare & and conduct performance & stability studies on rheology innovation and needs to answer projects needs
* Work within a multi-disciplined team to create business relevant technical solutions
* Support project teams to create technical insights using appropriate design of experiments
* Contribute to technical project teams, providing data, & lab support in Innovation
* Participate in and run fragrance evaluation panels
* Drive and deliver improvements and innovations for the current and expanding portfolio of capsule technologies as well as other fabric platforms.
* Develop a network of colleagues within IFF to expand application & business knowledge
* Ensure work is managed in a timely, reliable way and according to the highest standards
* Follow safe laboratory practices
* Maintain excellent awareness of the Fabric Care market and market products
* To be curious about fragrance technology innovation and have passion to solve related problems
* Playing a proactive role in new initiatives.
* Support technology scouting IP/literature review

Essential skills & competencies* Excellent Lab Skills
* Able to react quickly to changing environments
* Efficient planning skills
* Turning data into actionable insights
* Experience in product application/development
* Result driven and excellent problem-solving skills
* Customer focused
* DOE (design of experiment) experience
* Ability to work cross-functionally
* Results oriented
* Knowledgeable in lab safety, relevant application, raw materials and chemical processes
* Fluent in English, other language proficiency (French, Dutch, German) is a plus.
  

Competencies* Curious, enjoys a difficult challenge
* Good interpersonal and communication skills
* Drives to deliver business relevant technical solutions
* Open minded, embraces diversity, shows courage (take risks, learns from success and failure), flexible, deals well with pressure
* Team player
* Passionate about fragrance and product development
* Demonstrates a strong quality of perseverance
* Self-motivated.

Preferred Skills* Project planning skills
* Home or Personal Care formulation, Polymer, Colloid Science experience
* Good olfactory evaluation skills (an internal test will be part of the interview process)
* Experience in the fragrance/flavor or fast-moving consumer goods industry.
  

Required Experience* Bachelors or Masters in Chemistry, Polymer, Colloid science or related discipline
* 2-3 years working experience in the industry or in comparable industries (consumer products), preferably in an international environment.

We are a global leader in taste, scent, and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex, or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.
Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more

title: Research Technician (Molecular Biology)
description:
ProQR Therapeutics is a biotechnology company listed on NASDAQ with offices in Leiden, the Netherlands and Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA. ProQR is focused on the development of life changing RNA therapies to meet the unmet need of individuals and families with common and rare diseases. A team of 150+ enthusiastic ProQRians from all walks of life and more than 30 different nationalities is up to this challenge. We have the passion and commitment to make a difference in the lives of the communities we serve. Our proprietary Axiomer RNA editing technology platform enables the editing of specific single nucleotides in RNA using the cells own editing machinery. Axiomer RNA editing technology harnesses ADAR (Adenosine Deaminase Acting on RNA), which is machinery present in all human cells to repair G-to-A mutations, modulate protein, and enable protective mutation functions. Axiomer could potentially yield a new class of innovative medicines and treat currently untreatable diseases.


Our R&D department is currently looking for an experienced **Research Technician** to join our team in Leiden. In collaboration with other multi-disciplinary team members, the research technician (molecular biology) will investigate interactions that regulate EON-mediated editing and will work closely together with other (Senior) Research Technicians and Scientists.

**We expect our R****esearch technician** **to have:**

* At least an HLO/BSc degree in life science or molecular biology with a minimum of 2 years working experience (preferably in industry)
* Experience with culture of primary cells and cell lines
* Experience with RNA analysis techniques, e.g. RNA isolation, cDNA synthesis, (digital) PCR, RT-qPCR, sample preparation for RNA Sequencing, ribonuclease assay
* Experience with protein analysis techniques, e.g. Western blot, immunocytochemistry and ELISA
* Basic knowledge of RNA biology and modifications

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design, plan and execute experiments
* Contribute to optimization of methods and protocols for RNA analysis
* Critically analyze data from experiments and report these in an electronic lab journal
* Contribute to laboratory organization and related administrative tasks

**Skills and competencies that are required for making the difference:**

* Analytical and accurate
* Flexible and adaptable
* Being able to prioritize multiple tasks
* Pro-active and pragmatic self-starter, with a result-oriented mindset
* Team player
* Autonomous and coachable
* Being able to work in a fast-paced environment
* Creative thinker
* Patient-oriented attitude
* Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English
* A nice person

**ProQR as an employer**

As an employer, we are a true believer of the value of a workforce in which people from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to develop themselves, personally and professionally. We believe that happy and energized people, working well together in an environment in which they thrive, will do phenomenal and awesome things.


We are committed to ensure that no employee, candidate, or job applicant receives less favorable treatment on the grounds of race, age, disability, pregnancy, religion, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, marriage or civil partnership status. At ProQR we want to create an inclusive culture where everyone can be valued for who they are and in which individual differences and the contributions in all forms are recognized and valued.


We offer an exciting and innovative working environment in a very committed organization, with the following benefits:


* 8% holiday allowance
* 30 vacation days
* An annual performance bonus
* Stock options
* A premium-free pension plan
* A commuting allowance
* A subsidized staff restaurant
* Unlimited (un)healthy snacks and drinks
* Employee events (boot camp, Rebel Café and other social events)

Do you think you can contribute to achieving our mission? If so, we’re looking forward to receiving your application by filling out our application form.


You can contact Silvia Catellani via recruitment@proqr.com if you have any questions.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher in eHealth and Data Personalization for Promoting Physical Activity in Children with Heart Disease - Convergence Healthy Start
description:
**Postdoctoral Researcher in eHealth and Data Personalization for Promoting Physical Activity in Children with Heart Disease - Convergence Healthy Start**
==========================================================================================================================================================


Passionate about Helping Children with Heart Disease Lead More Active Lives through eHealth and Data Personalization? Join Our Innovative Transdisciplinary Team!


Closing date 30-09-2024
35.05.24.TS
  
### **Job description**


For children with heart disease, sufficient physical activity is critical for their physical and mental health, and overall quality of life. However, many of these children remain insufficiently active due to a variety of complex and individualized factors, including low self-efficacy and parental overprotection. Addressing these challenges requires a transdisciplinary and systems approach that involves the children, their parents, and their environment.  

  

Convergence Healthy Start is a collaborative initiative between Erasmus University, Delft Technical University, and Erasmus MC, dedicated to addressing the early-life origins of disparities in health and well-being through innovative, transdisciplinary partnerships. This postdoctoral project is port of our team's ambition to enhance the physical activity of children with heart disease by using personalized eHealth interventions in a home-based setting. Our transdisciplinary team includes paediatric cardiologists, social scientists, exercise scientists, industrial designers, and engineers. We are seeking a dedicated Postdoctoral Researcher with expertise in data personalization and eHealth interventions to join us in this mission.  

  

The successful candidate will:


* Collect and interpret data from medical records, wearables, and mobile apps to define risk profiles for children with insufficient physical activity.

Utilize data personalization * -a process that involves analysing and interpreting large datasets to develop customized physical activity plans tailored to the unique needs of each child.
* Further develop personalized interventions initiated by the team's PhD students, in co-design with healthcare professionals, designers, social scientists, and families of children with heart disease.
* Publish research findings in high-impact journals and present at scientific conferences.
* Contribute to grant writing and securing funding for ongoing and future research projects.

  

  

If you are passionate about using eHealth and data personalization to help children with heart defects lead more active and healthier lives, we would love to hear from you! Join our innovative transdisciplinary team and make a meaningful impact.


  
### **Work environment**


The Convergence Program fosters a dynamic ecosystem for research and innovation in South Holland, attracting significant national and international attention. As a postdoc in this program, you will be formally based in the pediatric cardiology division of Erasmus MC-Sophia Children's Hospital, while also collaborating extensively with TU Delft and Erasmus University. This provides a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of cutting-edge medical research, engineering, and social sciences.  

  

This postdoc project is closely linked to other initiatives that leverage smart technology to promote physical activity in children with heart defects. As part of the Healthy Start program, you will join a diverse and interdisciplinary team of experts in paediatric cardiology, sports medicine, exercise science, industrial design, and social sciences. You will also work in close collaboration with patient organizations, hospitals, and other stakeholders to ensure that our research translates into practical, real-world applications that directly benefit children and their families.  

  

Moreover, you will be an active member of the Healthy Start Community, participating in various activities and contributing to the program's goals. This collaborative and multidisciplinary environment offers a unique opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the health and well-being of children with heart disease. For more information, visit https://convergence.nl/healthy-start/


  
### **Qualifications and skills**


As a Postdoctoral Researcher, you possess strong analytical skills and extensive experience in data analysis and interpretation, including proficiency in AI and machine learning techniques. You have a natural affinity for working in a transdisciplinary team, particularly with children who have congenital heart disease and their parents.  

  

Desired qualifications:


* PhD in a relevant field such as biomedical engineering, computer science, data science, medical technology, social sciences, medicine or a related discipline.
* Experience with data personalization and eHealth intervention development.
* Proven track record of scientific dissemination, including publishing in peer-reviewed journals and presenting at scientific conferences.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
* A basic command of Dutch is preferred, given the interaction with the target audience.

  

 

Before you apply please check our conditions for employment.


  
### **Terms of employment**

  

* You will receive a temporary position for 4 years.
* A gross monthly salary between € 4.678 and € 6.402,- (scale 11) based on a fulltime workweek of 36 hours.
* Working from home (partially) is an option.
* Excellent fringe benefits, such as a 13th month that is already paid out in November and an individual travel expense package.
* An International Office which aids you in preparing for you arrival and stay.
* Pension insurance with ABP, we take care of 70% of the monthly contribution.
* Special benefits, such as an in-company physiotherapist and bicycle repairer. There is also a gym where you can work on your fitness after work.

  
### **More information**


If you are excited by the thought of this position and would like to apply, please do so by using the application form on our website.  

  

For more information about this position, please contact Arend van Deutekom, Paediatric Cardiologist via 06 246 775 23 or send a WhatsApp.

  

No agencies please.
company_description: Meewerken aan de zorg van de toekomst. Het begint met doen.

title: Data Analytics Consultant
description:
**Data Analytics Consultant**  

What if your expertise as a Data Analytics Consultant would help build the data foundation needed to create state of the art predictive models supporting our business and customers every single day? What if your knowledge, skills, and enthusiasm would contribute directly to the success of a global company?



You bridge the gap between business, data and technology. You identify the needs for data of the data scientists and translate them into the right data products.



You will be working in an international team of professionals that have a true passion for what they do. DLL is an IRB financial institution with a unique combination of great opportunities, short reporting lines and broad responsibilities. Data is essential to everything we do, and we rely on dedicated teams of specialists, from data collection to modelling, validation to model implementation. Collaboration is the tool we use to achieve our goals and ambitions. Together, through diversity and inclusion, we will become better at what we do.



Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL

 **Day to day:**  

* As a Data Analytics Consultant, you are responsible for the availability and quality of the data for our Risk- and Non-Regulatory Models.
* Responsible for the Coordination of the Data collection and the Data analysis at content level.
* Responsible for improving the data content and data quality at the source level.
* Together with the team of modelers you decide what data is necessary to successfully develop a model.
* You will investigate if the requested data is already available on the Azure Data Platform.
* If not, you will work closely together with departments in different countries to collect and test the data.
* You will also work closely together with IT to automate the onboarding of the data on the Azure data platform from different applications.
* Next step is to test the quality of the data. If necessary, you will initiate actions together with IT and the application owners to improve the data quality.
* If the necessary data is available and of good quality, you are responsible to transform the data into an integrated model dataset and make it available to the modelers.
* This is an iterative process until the model meets the required performance.
* Together with the team, you are responsible for the data on the data platform and help ensure that there is proper governance around changes in the model data landscape.
* You will also support documentation of data collection and testing activities as well as validation of these activities by the Model Validation team where needed.
* You will provide guidance and support to less experienced team members in the above areas.
* You will, in the above activities, interact with stakeholders from many different teams/departments, such as Predictive Modeling, Data Management, (local) Finance, Sales, and IT.
* You will report to the manager Data Analytics.


 **All members enjoy**

* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home.
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.


“We lead the way in meeting the need for flexibility and transparency which our customers increasingly expect”

 **Essentials:**  

* A Bachelor or Master’s degree in a data- or IT-related field.
* 5-7 years of professional experience working in a similar role.
* Understanding data is a true passion of yours.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Proven experience in executing quantitative analyses using SQL and R/Python, and ability to work with MS Excel.
* Proven Experience in working with Microsoft Azure technology and Databricks.
* You have a good eye for detail and strong interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated affinity with the development of predictive models.
* You are a self-starter and able to work in an organization with a complex system and data landscape.
* Strong analytical and project management skills.


**Extras:**


* Knowledge and experience with the application of Agile and Scrum practices.
* Prior experience working in the Finance industry / credit risk domain and knowledge of relevant regulation.
* Preference to work in a dynamic, international environment.

  

**Choose wellbeing**  

DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.



Our four wellbeing categories are as follows:


* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL

 **Settling in**  

At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.



But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.



Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.



Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.



We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind: **Partnering for a better world.**

 **Good to know:**  

* Deadline for application: September 15th (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website
* DLL’s referral program applies
* #LI-NA1
* For more information, please contact our Talent Acquisition Partner Natascha Hooi via Natascha.Hooi@dllgroup.com


DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.



DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

  

Job Reference: DLL NL02746
company_description: DLL specializes in asset-based financing programs for equipment manufacturers, dealers and distributors all over the world.

title: Staff Software Engineer II - ML/CV
description:
*Lead innovation at the forefront of technology, where your work will redefine what’s possible in machine learning and distributed systems.*
*Step into a pivotal role where your leadership will drive groundbreaking projects, setting new standards in safety and efficiency for millions worldwide!*

As a Staff Software Engineer II, you’ll drive projects and shape the future of our technology, directly impacting millions of users by enhancing the safety and efficiency of our advanced systems. By enhancing real-time data processing, your innovations will directly improve critical infrastructure, leading to safer, more efficient public services that millions rely on daily.
### **What you’ll do**

* Drive the next generation of technology by owning the software architecture and leading the design of scalable solutions that meet complex challenges
* Lead teams in deploying and optimizing large-scale models with Apache Spark, Databricks, and MLFlow, tackling challenges of real-time data processing in highly distributed environments.
* Manage and coordinate across multiple teams, serving as a force multiplier by driving technical leadership and ensuring the success of 20+ engineers.
* Work closely with teams of software engineers, data scientists, and product managers to align projects with business objectives.
* Design and build scalable, highly available, and resilient applications using cutting-edge cloud technologies. Your work will directly contribute to improving the lives of people through better and smarter technology.
* Guide and mentor engineers across teams, fostering a collaborative environment that promotes learning and growth.
* Participate in all phases of the project lifecycle, from gathering requirements and designing solutions to building interfaces and deploying systems into production.

### **What you’ll need**

* You have a proven track record as a senior-level software engineer with significant experience in **machine learning**, **computer vision**, data engineering, and large-scale distributed systems.
* Your expertise in programming, system design, and cloud technologies allows you to create systems that handle vast amounts of data reliably and efficiently
* You’re a natural leader with a knack for guiding & impacting teams through complex projects, always driving towards excellence in engineering and operational best practices.
* Your strategic vision will guide our teams toward new opportunities, directly influencing the company’s growth and success in the competitive tech landscape.
* You thrive in diverse environments, working seamlessly with legal, design, operations, and product teams to deliver high-quality results.
* This position is based in Amsterdam. Therefore, we can only accept candidates that already live in or are in the process of relocating to Amsterdam area.

**What we offer**  

A competitive compensation package, of course.  

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.  

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.  

Work from home, the office, or even abroad – each team has the flexibility to choose how they work based on business needs.  

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.  

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.  

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.  

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.  

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!  

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location. **Meet your team**  

We are the ADAS & ADS Product Unit, leading the production of TomTom’s HD maps and ADAS technology.
In a diverse team of applied scientists, engineers, data scientists, and more, equipped with a broad array of expertise, you’ll collaborate on groundbreaking location-based technologies and applications.
More specifically, you’ll be at the forefront of the creation of advanced HD maps. You’ll also help update these in real-time, ensuring our maps are pushing the world forward instantly. These maps will then go on to empower the largest car manufacturers, transportation giants, and major tech companies around the world.  

  

  

**At TomTom...**  

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.  

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them. **After you apply**  

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs. **TomTom is an equal opportunity employer**  

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, *you*. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.
company_description: At TomTom, we want to engineer the first real-time map. You might think it has been done before but it hasn't. Help us make it happen – become a mapmaking trailblazer.

title: Innovation Scientist I
description:
Job Summary
We are IFF. We are the catalyst for discoveries that spark the senses and transform the everyday. International Flavors & Fragrances Inc. is a leading innovator of sensorial experiences that move the world. At the heart of our company, we are fueled by a sense of discovery, constantly asking, “what if?”  

  

That passion for exploration drives us to create unique scents and tastes in fine fragrances and beauty, detergents and household goods, as well as beverages, confectionary and food products.  

  

Our global team members take advantage of leading consumer insights, research and development, creative expertise, and customer intimacy to develop differentiated products. Dreamers and doers, we work tirelessly to discover flavors and fragrances that inspire customers and delight consumers. We are fueled by our four corporate values; passion, creativity, expertise and empowerment. It is the unique blend of these values that make us IFF. The Company leverages its competitive advantages of brand understanding and consumer insight combined with its focus on R&D and innovation, to provide customers with differentiated product solutions.  

The Role  

As a Scientist within the Scent Technology and Innovation team, you will work together with R&D, Perfumers, Operations and Commercial teams to create and deliver innovative technologies. You will be responsible for understanding how these technologies interact with fragrances ingredients and customers formulations in order to design and deliver fragrance solutions which will delight our consumers. You will be part of the Fabric Care team located in Hilversum and will share our knowledge and learning with other teams globally.  

Major Responsibilities Include* Drive, Plan, Conduct & Report laboratory work for Innovation projects
* Develop and present technical information to support project decision making in order to deliver truly differentiated solutions
* Work with R&D, Perfumers, Evaluators and Operation teams to identify and understand the challenges and risks
* Design, prepare & and conduct performance & stability studies on rheology innovation and needs to answer projects needs
* Work within a multi-disciplined team to create business relevant technical solutions
* Support project teams to create technical insights using appropriate design of experiments
* Contribute to technical project teams, providing data, & lab support in Innovation
* Participate in and run fragrance evaluation panels
* Drive and deliver improvements and innovations for the current and expanding portfolio of capsule technologies as well as other fabric platforms.
* Develop a network of colleagues within IFF to expand application & business knowledge
* Ensure work is managed in a timely, reliable way and according to the highest standards
* Follow safe laboratory practices
* Maintain excellent awareness of the Fabric Care market and market products
* To be curious about fragrance technology innovation and have passion to solve related problems
* Playing a proactive role in new initiatives.
* Support technology scouting IP/literature review

Essential skills & competencies* Excellent Lab Skills
* Able to react quickly to changing environments
* Efficient planning skills
* Turning data into actionable insights
* Experience in product application/development
* Result driven and excellent problem-solving skills
* Customer focused
* DOE (design of experiment) experience
* Ability to work cross-functionally
* Results oriented
* Knowledgeable in lab safety, relevant application, raw materials and chemical processes
* Fluent in English, other language proficiency (French, Dutch, German) is a plus.
  

Competencies* Curious, enjoys a difficult challenge
* Good interpersonal and communication skills
* Drives to deliver business relevant technical solutions
* Open minded, embraces diversity, shows courage (take risks, learns from success and failure), flexible, deals well with pressure
* Team player
* Passionate about fragrance and product development
* Demonstrates a strong quality of perseverance
* Self-motivated.

Preferred Skills* Project planning skills
* Home or Personal Care formulation, Polymer, Colloid Science experience
* Good olfactory evaluation skills (an internal test will be part of the interview process)
* Experience in the fragrance/flavor or fast-moving consumer goods industry.
  

Required Experience* Bachelors or Masters in Chemistry, Polymer, Colloid science or related discipline
* 2-3 years working experience in the industry or in comparable industries (consumer products), preferably in an international environment.

We are a global leader in taste, scent, and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex, or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.
Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more

521 West 57th Street
New York, NY 10019
United States

Tel: +1 (212) 765-5500
http://www.iff.com/contact-us

title: Junior Researcher Privacy risk perception in the smarthome at the crossroads of psychology and law
description:
#### **Key takeaways**

* Hours
8 hr.
* Salary indication
Salary gross/monthly  

based on full-time
€ 3,345
* Deadline
15 Sep 2024


Smart home devices become more and more common in people’s households. Besides bringing numerous benefits, smart home devices also introduce new risks, specifically in relation to privacy.



In this project you will examine how users of smart devices perceive the risks of state and commercial surveillance conducted through smart home devices and develop and test a possible intervention to increase awareness of the risks and, in turn, protective action against the risks.



The research involves both qualitative and quantitative research conducted over the course of 40 weeks. You will perform the research as part of a multidisciplinary team involving two social scientists (both at the Utwente) and two legal researchers (from the VU Amsterdam), that all have a long track record on research around smart home technology.



You will co-design and execute data-collection through interviews and a questionnaire study, analyse the data, and aid in writing up the findings in a journal publication.



You will be located in the section of Psychology of Conflict, Risk and Safety, that has a strongly growing expertise on the topic of privacy, security and psychology.


### **Your profile**

* MSc-degree in psychology or a related discipline (candidates close to graduating are also encouraged to apply);
* Demonstrably good writing skills;
* A proactive, assertive, creative, practical, and resilient attitude towards research;
* Knowledge of and experience with both quantitative and qualitative research;
* Affinity with the topics of risk perception, privacy, and smart home technology;
* Good communication skills and an excellent command of English;
* Command of the Dutch or German language desirable for conducting interviews and questionnaires;
* Willingness to travel to the VU in Amsterdam every 1-2 months.
### **Our offer**

* A part-time position for 8 hours a week, for 40 weeks, and the flexibility to work (partially) from home;
* Your salary and associated conditions are in accordance with the collective labour agreement for Dutch universities (CAO-NU). You will receive a gross monthly salary off € 3.345,- (scale 10.0) based on fulltime;
* There are excellent benefits including a holiday allowance of 8% of the gross annual salary, an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%, and a solid pension scheme;
* A minimum of 232 leave hours in case of full-time employment based on a formal workweek of 38 hours;
* Free access to sports facilities on campus.
### **Information and application**



Are you interested in this position? Please send your application via the '' button below before September 15 and include a CV, motivation letter and a sample of your writing.



For more information please contact Nicole Huijts, n.m.a.huijts@utwente.nl.

#### 


### **About the department**



At the department of Technology, Human and Institutional Behaviour (HIB), we are specialists in the science of behaviour change and the interplay between human behaviour and technology.
  

Why do we behave the way we do, and how does our behaviour change? Why is it that some people can successfully adapt their diet or lifestyle, and others seem unable to? What drives behavioural changes among people and groups? How can our governments help us to behave in ways that are healthy, sustainable and inclusive, or that will make our countries, societies and cities a safer place to live? What role can technologies play – from virtual reality or artificial intelligence to human-media interaction and value-based design – in influencing our behaviour for the better? And, conversely, what does our behaviour tell us about how these new technologies should be developed? These are some of the key questions we deal with as researchers, educators and societal problem solvers at the HIB department.


### **About the organisation**



The Faculty of Behavioral, Management and Social sciences (BMS) aims to play a key role in understanding, jointly developing and evaluating innovations in society. Technological developments are the engine of innovation. As a technical university that puts people first, we tailor them to human needs and behavior and use social engineering to integrate them into society. We also ensure adequate governance at public and private level, and robust, inclusive and fair organizational structures. We do this by developing, sharing and applying high-quality knowledge in Psychology, Business Administration, Public Administration, Communication Sciences, Philosophy, Educational Sciences and Health Sciences. Our research and education in these disciplines revolves around tackling and solving societal challenges. The research programs of BMS are closely linked to the research of the UT institutes Mesa+ Institute for Nanotechnology, TechMed Center and Digital Society Institute.



As an employer, the Faculty of BMS offers work that matters. We equip you to create new possibilities for yourself and for our society. With us, you will become part of a leading technical university with increasing, positive social impact. We offer an open, inclusive and entrepreneurial atmosphere, in which we encourage you to make healthy choices, for example through our flexible, adaptable benefits.
company_description: Join the university of technology that puts people first. Combine science, technology and social awareness at the University of Twente

title: Sales Enablement Executive
description:
**Job Description**  

Amstelveen, Netherlands


ABOUT THIS JOB


NIQ is seeking a talented Sales Enablement Specialist to play a key role in enabling sellers to be more efficient and stay focused on renewing and winning business.


The Sales Enablement is a role supporting our Account Development team across Manufacturer clients on pre-sales tasks and content generation. This is a critical role in the overall sales process developing commercial and client-ready material that increases the capacity of our sales team and improving our new business strike rate.


The ideal candidate will understand our business and clients and have the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to achieve all objectives.

  

  

RESPONSIBILITIES

* Partner with Sales to lead key RFP (request for proposal) response workstreams, including contract creation based on existing templates and seller inputs, checks with sellers and legal teams and provide scope/pricing/solution summaries to meet deadlines effectively.
* Serve as an expert on internal sales processes and CRM utilization, guiding sellers on best practices and ensuring adherence to analytics-focused methodologies.
* Effectively manage day-to-day tasks to ensure sellers can move opportunities to “close won” as quickly as possible, including assisting with pitches, pricing, proposals, and contracts
* Support sellers in producing compelling and visually engaging presentations using tools such as PowerPoint, with a focus on effectively conveying complex data and insights through clear and impactful visualizations.
* Serve as an expert on the available content and the location of assets, including managing the sales material repository on SharePoint.
* Create and/or adapt existing content in format and branding (including pitch decks, proposals, and email templates) based on sales insights, personas, and segments.
* Leading the yearly price increase letter process, tailoring the existing template to client specific content together with the Account Development manager.


A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU


The ideal candidate is a proactive, punctual task manager with an eye for process improvement. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented with excellent verbal and written English communication, active listening, and time management skills, especially in a data-centric environment. You are motivated by closing client agreements and thrive in a dynamic and constantly changing environment. You must be passionate about ensuring a positive customer experience and understand how to personalize data-driven messaging to ensure buyers have the right information at the right time to make decisions quickly and confidently.


QUALIFICATIONS

* MBO 4 (e.g. Schoevers) or associate degree in a relevant field such as Business, Sales or Marketing.
* 2-4 years of experience working in a similar position, preferably in FMCG, market intelligence/research or working with NIQ/ GfK data and insights.
* Excellent oral and written command of the Dutch and English languages.
* Familiarity with Microsoft Dynamics is a plus.
* Ability to maintain client contracts as part of a team or independently, with a strong emphasis on punctuality
* Able to effectively communicate in a cross-department environment.
* Ability to work with large data sets


What is in it for you

* Work for the world’s leading consumer intelligence company in an exciting international work environment for a diverse team.
* An open and energetic team, where collaboration and innovation thrive and where you can feel the impact of your work. .
* A flexible work environment with a hybrid home/office system.
* Initial and ongoing trainings to support your personal and professional growth
* Attractive compensation package with a base and variable component pension etc.

 **Additional Information** **Our Benefits**

* Flexible working environment
* Volunteer time off
* LinkedIn Learning
* Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


**About NIQ**


NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.


For more information, visit NIQ.com


Want to keep up with our latest updates?


Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook


**Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**


NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion
company_description: NielsenIQ is the industry leader in global measurement and data analytics, and the most trusted source for retail and consumer intelligence.

title: Diagnostics and Infrastructure engineer
description:
Introduction


Are you challenged by demanding projects in a multidisciplinary context? Do you love working with data and solving business critical problems? Are you looking to work closely with customers internal stakeholders and see the daily impact your work creates for ASML? Then we have an exciting opportunity in the EUV Source Laser department.


.

**Context of the Position**


ASML’s Development & Engineering sector is responsible for the specification, design and realization of all products in the ASML portfolio. Within this sector, the source laser department drives for improvements in source laser performance, availability and cycle time, performance & equipment diagnostics, performance qualification, automation and sequence design.


.

**Job Mission**


By translating complicated physical processes into concise analyses together with a multidisciplinary team and suppliers, you will contribute to the development of business-critical diagnostics applications.


.

**Job Description**


As an engineer in the Source Laser Diagnostics team, you will have a front-seat in building solutions that are used on a daily basis to make important business decisions as part of supplier and customer negotiations. D&E and CS colleagues will depend on your work to meet challenging customer reporting demands and support high profile escalations.


.


We are looking for an ambitious engineer who is not afraid to dig deep into the data and the physics of the source laser and translate this understanding into diagnostics solutions. You will collaborate with the team’s diagnostics architect and product owner to implement and develop part of the product roadmap and secure technical alignment with teams from other functions as well as suppliers.


.


As part of your work, you will also interact with end-users and see the results of your work in action.


.

**Responsibilities**

* Lead a complex technical design or have ownership of diagnostics solutions that require contribution from several engineers and suppliers. As well as to contribute to the design of engineering solutions; design the feasibility testing approach and supervise its implementation to support the development and validation of engineering solutions.


Detail out the design including its documentation.
* Coordinate and participate in the development of metric algorithms that produce meaningful data, in collaboration with engineers of teams of adjacent /collaborating Functional Clusters, interfaces within team of a train or multiple products.
* Functional qualification of code, identify and execute recommendations to improve code quality to ensure scalability.
* Develop vision for diagnostics, including relational cascading of performance KPI's and automated service mix recommendations. devise new approaches to problems encountered.
* Look at problems from multiple known angles and propose different ‘out of the box’ solutions to choose from, in an environment with technical uncertainty. Balances between quality and timely delivery.
* Plan and coordinate the identification, elicitation of requirements, conduct analysis of those requirements for completion and alignment, document and manage requirements throughout the life of the project and coordinate the verification of the end deliverable. Generally done at the project level.
* Contribute to and support feasibility studies from a technological and organizational perspective, and document findings.
* Oversee the dependencies between project team tasks, assist Scrum Master and Product Owner in planning, proactively signal risk of not delivering on spec and in time, translate weekly deliverables in daily tasks and maintain daily task plan, deliver weekly deliverables. Provide effort estimates for own or similar tasks.


.

**Education**


Technical higher vocational education or university, BSc or MSc


.

**Experience**

* BSc or MSc, with 3+ years of industry experience and working in multidisciplinary teams
* Evidence of ability to grasp and work with physical concepts OR knowledge of fundamental ASML technology, Source Laser is a plus
* Solid background on data analysis and visualization, working knowledge of python coding
* Experience with data infrastructure and engineering in Cloud environments are desired
* Knowledge of common analysis and visualization tools (python, databricks, Grafana, PowerBI etc.)
* Knows how Agile devops teams work


.

**Personal Skills**

* Takes the initiative, is creative and is willing to learn and adapt quickly
* Maintains helicopter view and can cover broad technical scope
* Good stakeholder management
* Flexible and committed team player
* Pragmatic attitude, result orientation with an analytical view
* Able to make quality decisions
* Effective communication skills, knows how to convey complex topics in an concise manner


.

**Other information**


For more guidance and insights on the ASML Recruitment process, please have a look at: Applying for a job at ASML


.


Please submit a cover letter together with your application!

*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.*

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------


ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.
company_description: ASML provides chipmakers with hardware, software and services to mass produce patterns on silicon, helping to build the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained and connected.

title: Data Analytics Instructor - Corporate Trainer
description:
Are you an experienced **Data Analytics** professional passionate about corporate training?

**London Premier Centre** is seeking a skilled Freelance **Data Analytics Instructor - Corporate Trainer** to join our team in Amsterdam. This is an excellent opportunity to leverage your industry expertise and help develop the skills of professionals in the field of data analytics.

**Job Description:**

As a Data Analytics Instructor, you will be responsible for creating and delivering customized training sessions for corporate clients. You will provide industry-specific knowledge and practical insights to help professionals enhance their data-driven decision-making and analytical skills.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and deliver tailored training content focused on data analysis, visualization, statistical methods, and business intelligence tools.
* Adapt training materials to meet the specific needs of various corporate clients.
* Engage participants through dynamic and practical teaching methods.
* Be available for on-site training sessions and travel to client locations as needed.

**Requirements:**

* Expertise in data analysis, visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau), programming languages (e.g., Python, R), and data management.
* Experience delivering training in English (both spoken and written).
* Strong presentation and communication skills.
* Ability to design and deliver engaging and informative training sessions.
* Flexibility to travel and work independently or as part of a team.

**Qualifications:**

* A bachelor's degree or higher in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science).
* Relevant certifications such as Google Data Analytics, Microsoft Data Analyst, or equivalent are a plus.

Job Type: Contract  
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: From €1,00 per hour

Expected hours: 12 – 20 per week

Application Question(s):

* Can you describe your experience in the Data Analytics and how it aligns with the needs of corporate training?

Language:

* English (Required)

Expected Start Date: 07/09/2024

title: Postdoctoral researcher (32-36 hours/week)
description:
### **Function description**


Within the research group of Prof. Dr. VP Retèl and Prof. Wim H. van Harten we search for a talented and ambitious individual to participate a broad scala of projects regarding (very) early Health technology Assessment (HTA) of innovative technologies in precision oncology. Initially the two main projects are related to projects on influencing high prices of innovative cancer drugs, and developing the value of real world hospital data for HTA in the European OncoValue project. The first project is sponsored by an international consortium of Cancer Charities in the European Fair Pricing Network, and will be the main focus of the postdoc. Two PhD students are working on topics of price- and R&D transparency, equity in access to medicines, real-life experiments concerning bargaining power, where the postdoc will have a supervisory- but also active research role.  

  

Besides the ongoing projects the Postdoc is expected to participate in other projects and to start developing his/her own line of research by joining us in drafting project proposals. Further we are facilitating calculations for grant proposals and the accompanying textual proposals for newly to develop, and stimulating HTAs according our research line in (early) Health economics in precision oncology in the NKI-AVL.  

  

We are looking for an individual who sees this as career challenge, and is interested in discussing the design and results of broader HTA projects with physicians and other healthcare professionals in the Antoni van Leeuwenhoek hospital. This close collaboration between research and clinical practice supports new innovations to be implemented most optimally and as fast as possible into the clinic.  

  

Supervisors for the projects are Prof. Dr. Valesca Retèl and Prof. Dr. Wim van Harten, in collaboration with the various project specific PI’s such as fundamental researchers and physicians from the Antoni van Leeuwenhoek hospital.  

  

**Inspiring international atmosphere** Approximately 550 people work in the NKI research laboratory and many of the clinicians are involved in research. Work discussions, lectures and seminars are inspiring and a large number of non-Dutch post-docs, students and staff members contribute to the stimulating and international atmosphere of the Institute. The group of Retèl and van Harten is positioned within the department of Psychosocial and Epidemiological research (PSOE) and currently 1 postdoc, 9 PhDs, a research assistant and a number of master students involved in health technology assessment/health economics and mathematic modelling.
### **Job requirements**


* We are searching for a postdoctoral investigator with the following expertise and experience:
* You have an PhD degree in Health Sciences, Health Economics, Epidemiology, industrial engineering, Biomedical sciences or any related field, with experience in aspects related to HTA and health economics and/or motivation to work in healthcare.
* You are interested in applied decision modelling in the field of health care (connection with the clinic is very strong).
* You have good verbal and written communication skills (English).
* Experience with performing statistical analyses/modelling (Excel, SPSS, Stata or R).
* Interest in Health care policy.


### **Compensation**


Your temporary employment will be for a period of 4 years. The gross salary per month will be according to the standard postdoc scales, FWG 55, scale 6, depending on previous experience and status of PhD finalization. In addition you will receive a fixed end-of-year bonus (8,33%) and you will receive 8,33% holiday pay. The terms of employment will be in accordance with the Collective Labor Agreement for Hospitals.  

Your travel expenses will be reimbursed at € 0,19 per km. Free parking at the Antoni van Leeuwenhoek is also part of the package. Personnel is stimulated to use public transport and bicycle and therefore we offer an interesting arrangement for bikers and/or discount on the NS-business card.  

  

**How to apply**  

Please submit an electronic copy of your CV, preferably with the names and contact information of referents, and a cover letter describing education, research experience and research interests. To apply, click the 'Apply now' button at the bottom of the page. **The closing date is September 26th.**  

  

For further information and addresses visit our home page (www.nki.nl) or contact Prof. Wim H. van Harten (w.v.harten@nki.nl) or prof. V.P. Retèl (v.retel@nki.nl)
### **Details**


* Closing date: 26-09-2024
* Hours per week: 32-36u p/wk
* Salary level: Dutch Collective Labour Agreement for Hospitals
### **Mylene van der Velden**


Recruiter
06-41597142 m.vd.velden@nki.nl
### **Valesca Retèl**


v.retel@nki.nl

title: Statistics Leader
description:
**Site Name:** UK – London – New Oxford Street, Amsterdam, Collegeville TSA, Rockville Biopharm, Siena, Stevenage, Waltham, Wavre  

**Posted Date:** Aug 29 2024  

At GSK, we have bold ambitions for patients, aiming to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of the decade. R&D is committed to discovering and delivering transformational vaccines and medicines to prevent and change the course of disease. Science and technology are coming together in a way they never have before, and we have strong tech-enabled capabilities that allow us to build a deeper understanding of the patient, human biology and disease mechanisms, and transform medical discovery. We are revolutionising the way we do R&D. We’re uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.


Find out more:


Our approach to R&D.


This is an exciting opportunity to channel your passion for Innovation in the field of Statistics and Data Science to help shape the future of the Biostatistics function and transform the way in which GSK uses data and quantitative thinking to drive disease-aligned decision-making in R&D. We are recruiting a group of technically skilled statisticians to focus on enhancing disease-level knowledge for the company’s core strategic focus of oncology, immunology, respiratory, vaccines and infectious diseases. Working within our methodological centre for statistical innovation, and alongside colleagues deployed to project-facing programme and asset teams, you will build on existing work to build ‘disease-drug-trial’ models across the chevron of translational medicine and clinical development.


Biostatistics is the single-largest functional group of Statisticians, Programmers and Data Scientists within GSK R&D across the US, UK, Europe and India. Our mission is to put statistical thinking at the heart of R&D decision-making; to ensure that predictive models and well-designed experiments and trials deliver robust evidence as the input to those decisions – ultimately making the R&D process more efficient and increasing the probability of success. We are investing in our cutting-edge innovation capabilities by expanding the Statistics & Data Science Innovation Hub (SDS-IH) led by Prof Nicky Best. The vision of SDS-IH is to be the catalyst for innovation and advanced data-driven decision making.

**In this role you will…**

* *Enhance our disease understanding through the implementation of advanced statistical and/or machine learning methodologies across a range of areas from complex in-vitro models through to market access activities involving real world data to directly support business critical projects.*
* *Identify opportunities to utilize statistical methods to further enhance our disease understanding. Collaborate with cross functional quantitative groups to help determine the optimal analytical methods using appropriate data sources.*
* *Support the upskilling of Statisticians and other quantitative disciplines in statistical methodologies for disease understanding including their direct application in clinical development planning.*
* *Contribute to planning and lead implementation of small-to-moderate complexity projects within Biostatistics, ensuring they have clear objectives, achievable timelines, intermediate milestones, and well-defined criteria for success*
* *Present statistical principles, methods, study designs, and/or results transparently and precisely to GSK researchers and management across all levels, ensuring appropriate understanding and contributing to better quantitative decision-making across drug development*
* *Interact with external scientific groups (industry, academia, regulators) and vendors through presentations, publications, and collaborations, in order to contribute to innovation and uptake of novel statistical methodology and tools within GSK and across the pharmaceutical industry.*

***Why you?***


Qualifications & Skills:

* *PhD in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a closely related discipline (with formal statistical training).*
* *Post-graduate experience in clinical trials research in the pharmaceutical or a related industry and evidence of leading statistical methodology innovation. Individuals with an MS (or equivalent) in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a closely related discipline (with formal statistical training) may be considered provided they have significant post-graduate experience.*
* *Evidence, through publications, of methodological innovation and technical strength in advanced statistical modelling and/or modern machine learning techniques beyond research conducted during graduate studies.*
* *Proficiency in coding languages such as R, SAS, Python.*
* *Proficient in both spoken and written English, with the capability to clearly communicate both new and established statistical methods and results based on those methods to peers without substantial statistical training*


Preferred:

* *Post graduate work experience in statistical consulting, working alongside researchers from various fields to devise practical solutions in response to other researchers’ scientific questions of interest*
* *Post graduate work experience applying a broad array of foundational statistical methodologies, including but not limited to methods for study/experimental design, linear models, generalized linear models, linear and generalized mixed models, survival analysis, Bayesian methods, longitudinal data analysis, and causal inference.*
* *Post graduate work experience applying quantitative methodology in at least one of the following key areas: complex innovative trial design (e.g., Bayesian adaptive design), mathematical and/or computational models for disease processes, analysis of high-dimensional data (e.g., ‘omics data, imaging data)*
* *Knowledge of or interest multiple aspects of drug development, including drug discovery, preclinical development, and clinical development*
* *Experience working in high performance computing environments either for running intensive computational methods or for handling large simulation experiments*
* *Evidence of ability to publish quantitative methodological research or scientific research findings using advanced quantitative methodologies beyond research conducted during graduate studies*
* *Demonstrable evidence of influencing and partnering with diverse stakeholders of varying levels of seniority.*

*Application close date: 12th Sept*

**Why GSK?**

**Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.**

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organisation where people can thrive. We prevent and treat disease with vaccines, specialty and general medicines. We focus on the science of the immune system and the use of new platform and data technologies, investing in four core therapeutic areas (infectious diseases, HIV, respiratory/ immunology and oncology).


Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves – feeling welcome, valued, and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.


As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are open to all talent. In the US, we also adhere to Affirmative Action principles. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to neurodiversity, race/ethnicity, colour, national origin, religion, gender, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class\*(\*US only).


We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.


Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on Ukdiversity.recruitment@gsk.com or 0808 234 4391.


Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments, we will not be able to support you through these channels. However, we have created a UK Recruitment FAQ guide. Click the link and scroll to the Careers Section where you will find answers to multiple questions we receive


As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.

**Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies**


GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.


Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.

* *Proficient in both spoken and written English, with the capability to clearly communicate both new and established statistical methods and results based on those methods to peers without substantial statistical training*
