title: HRIT Specialist
description:
*Amsterdam, Netherlands* Apply until: **7 Sep 2024**Do you have experience in maintaining global HR systems, system configuration and a degree in information technology? Then you might be the new HR IT Specialist.

  

At Nouryon, our global team of Changemakers takes positive action every day, to reach higher collectively and individually. We create innovative and sustainable solutions for our customers to answer society’s needs – today and in the future.

  

* We are looking for team members who bring ideas forward, champion others and work together to do better. Does that sound like you?

**About the job**
-----------------


Unique role within our HR organization with a global impact.

  

In your future role as “ HR IT Specialist” you will

  

* Manage and maintain Global HR systems.
* Collaborate with HR and other departments to identify and address system requirements.
* Oversee data integrity, security and privacy within all of Nouryon’s HR systems

  

We believe you bring

  

* Degree in information technology
* Strong experience in HR IT administration, configuration, and support
* Strong understanding of HR processes and workflows
* In dept knowledge of HR IT platforms and technologies; SAP SuccessFactors, Kronos, People doc.

  

Great if you have

* Experience with reporting and visualization tools

  

We believe you are...  

Analytically strong and can think strategically.

  

  

We offer you

  

At Nouryon, we provide a great job and friendly coworkers, plus a bonus (STI) in addition to your salary. In this role you are applicable to have 30 vacation days.

  

Good to know

  

This is a permanent position on a full-time basis, reporting to the Global HR IT Managerand based in *Amsterdam*.

  

Please apply via our online recruitment system. We will not accept applications via e-mail. Once it's with us we will review to see if we have a match between your skills and the role! For more information about our hiring process, visit: nouryon.com/careers/how-we-hire/

  

We look forward to receiving your application!

  

We kindly ask our internal candidates to apply with your Nouryon email via Success Factors.

**About Nouryon**
-----------------

  

We’re looking for tomorrow’s Changemakers, today.

  

If you’re looking for your next career move, apply today and join Nouryon’s worldwide team of Changemakers in providing essential solutions that our customers use to manufacture everyday products such as personal care, cleaning, paints and coatings, agriculture and food, pharmaceuticals, and building products. Our employees are driven by the wish to make an impact and actively drive positive change. If that describes you, we will gladly make way for your ambitions. From day one we support you with your personal growth, through challenging positions and comprehensive learning and development opportunities, in a dynamic, international, diverse, and proactive working environment.

  

Visit our website and follow us on LinkedIn.

  

Contact

  

For additional information about the vacancy please contact.

  

If you have any questions about the recruitment process or your application or need assistance, please contact: job.sponselee@nouryon.com

 **#WeAreNouryon #Changemakers**

 *We have already chosen our sourcing channels for this recruitment and kindly ask not to be contacted by any advertisement agents, recruitment agencies or staffing companies.*

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
**About Us**Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.  

  

  

Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.  

  

  

We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.  

  

  

We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.  

  

  

**The Role:**As a Junior Data Analyst on our Partnerships and Affiliate Marketing team, you will play a critical role in supporting the success of our affiliate programs and partnerships. We are looking for someone who takes initiative, actively seeks out opportunities for improvement, and is eager to contribute to our team’s success.  

  

  

**In this Role, your responsibilities will include:*** Monitor and Analyze Performance: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various channels, identifying trends, and communicating to the team any anomalies, and opportunities for optimization.
* Generate Insights for Campaign Optimization: Assist in analyzing data to provide insights that help improve campaign performance, ROI, and overall marketing effectiveness.
* Develop and Maintain Dashboards: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of dashboards that provide real-time insights into program performance, making it easy for stakeholders to understand key metrics and trends.
* Support Partnership Strategies: Work with business developers and learn about the effectiveness of different partnerships, contributing data-driven recommendations for future collaborations.
* Take Initiative in Problem-Solving: Proactively identify issues or opportunities for optimization and develop strategies that improve overall performance.
* Collaborate Internationally: Work alongside marketing teams based in Shanghai and other global locations, ensuring that efforts align with broader marketing strategies and global business goals.
* Assist in Conducting Experiments: Support the design and analysis of experiments to test new strategies, creatives, or partnership models, contributing to data-driven decisions.
**What you'll Need to Succeed:*** Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
* Communication Skills: Ability to translate data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Basic SQL Knowledge: Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing datasets is preferred, with a willingness to develop these skills further.
* Experience with Data Analysis Tools: Strong skills in Excel or Google Sheets, including functions, data manipulation, and pivot tables. Experience with tools like Python, R, or BigQuery is a plus, offering opportunities to engage in more complex data analysis and automation.
* Basic Data Visualization Experience: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating dashboards and visual reports, with opportunities to develop proficiency.
* Interest in Partnerships and Affiliates: A strong curiosity and willingness to learn about affiliate marketing and partnership strategies, and how different factors affect our KPIs.
* Proactive, Collaborative, and Solution-Oriented: A self-starter who takes initiative in identifying opportunities for improvement and optimization. You enjoy developing solutions and contributing to projects, while also working collaboratively with cross-functional teams across different regions to achieve shared goals.
**Why Trip.com Group**We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.
What’s more?
* Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
* Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
* We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
* We encourage flexible work arrangement
Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.  

* 
  

Click the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?  

  

  

Click the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!  

  

  

Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com  

  

  

  

Have a good trip, and see you soon!

At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.
What’s more?
* Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
* Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
* We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
* We encourage flexible work arrangement

title: Data Scientist
description:
At Corbion, we exist to champion preservation in all its forms, preserving food and food production, health, and our planet.

  

We are currently looking for a **Data Scientist**, to expand our Data Science team in The Netherlands. Reporting to a Senior Data Scientist, you will join our Data Science team, part of the Data Management team within the dynamic and globally-focused Innovation Center, where research, innovation, and development are at the forefront of our strategy.


The ideal candidate will possess a strong affinity for working within a global matrix organization and exhibit a robust customer-centric approach.

 **Corbion's Data Science Team** plays a pivotal role in the IC and the whole Corbion to establish a data-driven culture and support informed decision making. The goal of the team is to effectively leverage advanced statistics and data science/digital solutions to derive actionable insights and create value from high-quality data. The team is actively engaged in developing innovative technologies for root-cause analysis and data-driven troubleshooting, process optimization and monitoring with e.g. chemometrics models, and Process Analytical Technology. We provide statistical support and modeling for various departments (such as Microbiology, Sensory), as well as process data and analysis systems for our fermentation processes, underpinning Corbion’s commitment to science-driven solutions and sustainable innovation.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

  

* Drive innovation initiatives to explore and implement emerging tools & technologies, and implement state-of-art Machine learning, optimization and statistical techniques to enhance predictive modelling, optimization, and decision-making processes.
* Be an advocate for developing data science competences (statistics, data mining, chemometrics) in the organization.
* Keep up to date with the latest developments in data science and share these with the team.

 **About you**

  

* Academic degree (MSc / Phd) in Data Science, Computer Science, another STEM field
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
* Experience with data visualization tools like PowerBI
* Software development skills and good practices such as Git, release management, unit tests, testing strategy.
* DevOps/ Agile way of working
* Analytical mindset and a critical way of thinking.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Able to work on-site in gorinchem (NL) for 2-3 days per week, the rest can be spent working from home
* Fluent in English

 **About Corbion**

  

Corbion is the global market leader in lactic acid and its derivatives, and a leading supplier of emulsifiers, functional enzyme blends, minerals, vitamins, and algae ingredients. We use our unique expertise in fermentation and other processes to deliver sustainable solutions for the preservation of food and food production, health, and our planet. For over 100 years, we have been uncompromising in our commitment to safety, quality, innovation and performance. Drawing on our deep application and product knowledge, we work side-by-side with customers to make our cutting-edge technologies work for them. Our solutions help differentiate products in markets such as food, home & personal care, animal nutrition, pharmaceuticals, medical devices, and bioplastics. In 2023, Corbion generated annual sales of €1,443.8 million and had a workforce of 2,727 FTE. Corbion is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. For more information: www.corbion.com

 ***Corbion does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers. All candidates must be submitted by approved Corbion vendors who have been expressly requested to make a submission by our Talent Acquisition team for a specific job opening. No placement fees will be paid to any firm unless such a request has been made by the Corbion Talent Acquisition team and such candidate was submitted to the Corbion Talent Acquisition Team.***

title: Senior Commercial Analyst (1)
description:
* Facebook
* LinkedIn
* X
* Email
* WeChat
* Xing
TenneT is growing fast to realize its strategic ambitions. We play a leading role in driving the energy transition. We are looking for a passionate **Senior Commercial Analyst** at our location **Arnhem** who will contribute to this and that might be you?

  

### **Your contribution to TenneT**

  

**Purpose of the job**


BritNed is a dynamic and international company with a variety of commercial functions. The Commercial Analyst works in a team which is involved in a broad range of activities to support our continuous business within the following areas:


* Monitoring our current and future commercial costs and risks and propose improvement measures to asset handling and commercial procedures;
* Development of new concepts or guide changes of existing concepts
* Develop business processes for the launch of new products or regulatory changes
* Participate in and lead (IT and business process related) implementation projects
* Participate in and lead compliance projects
* Organise internal and external training and certification sessions
* Be part of the further digitalisation and BI driven automation efforts of BritNed
* The successful applicant will also go on call one week in four and will be part of the team that responds in the event that the interconnector fails to limit commercial imbalance exposures.


### **Your profile and background**

**Candidate Profile Requirements:**


* Master or bachelor degree in business economics, informatics, electrical engineering (or similar field);


* Good organizational skills and the ability to keep track of multiple activities at once;


* Good / advanced understanding and experience in project management;


* Good team player with hands-on mentality;


* A good understanding of regulated electricity markets, market concepts and electricity trading;


* Excellent analytical skills, transforming data into information;


* Coding skills are a benefit (Python, Java, C, etc.)


* Ability to handle stressful situations and keeping oversight on what is important in high pressure situations;


* Good oral and written communications skills in English, in particular the ability to summarise complex processes, weighing up all of the relevant factors and giving recommendations;


Since BritNed is a dynamic environment a high level of flexibility and willingness to travel internationally is needed.


### **Our recruiting process**

### **Our offer**

**We are family friendly and flexible**  


Health - your basis
Modern working environment
Attractive remuneration and social benefits
Personal development
### **This will be our challenge**

Strategy and Partnerships is set up because of TenneT's needs in new ways of working to realize our ambition to advance the energy transition. In doing so, innovative partnerships will be key to driving scalable solutions for flexibility, renewable energy integration and digitalisation.
### **Additional information**

BritNed is organised as an international joint venture between the TSOs TenneT and National Grid while acting as the owner and operator of the high voltage direct current Interconnector linking the electricity markets of Great Britain and The Netherlands.


BritNed operates as merchant interconnector and strives to deliver unparalleled efficiency and reliability to support security of supply and the further integration of the European Energy Market to enable the energy transition.


We are an international organisation combining innovative technical and commercial expertise of multiple countries. Our employees are highly skilled and motivated people who are proud of 'their’ company. They work as one team with one vision joining the expertise of both TenneT and National Grid.


Since BritNed is both a merchant interconnector and a TSO, this role is a great opportunity to gain a thorough understanding of all relevant areas and aspects of this business within a dynamic and international context. For more information on BritNed, please visit our website: www.britned.com.

  

### **Salary**

3879 € - 7660 €
TenneT is a leading European grid operator. We are committed to providing a secure and reliable supply of electricity 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, while helping to drive the energy transition in our pursuit of a brighter energy future – more sustainable, reliable and affordable than ever before. In our role as the first cross-border Transmission System Operator (TSO) we design, build, maintain and operate over 25,000 kilometres of high-voltage electricity grid in the Netherlands and large parts of Germany, and facilitate the European energy market through our 17 interconnectors to neighbouring countries. We are one of the largest investors in national and international onshore and offshore electricity grids, with a turnover of EUR 9.2 billion and a total asset value of EUR 45 billion. Every day our 8,300 employees take ownership, show courage and make and maintain connections to ensure that the supply and demand of electricity is balanced for over 43 million people.  

TenneT is an equal opportunity employer for ALL and is fully committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity to ensure that all applicants and employees are considered for recruitment, promotion and employment regardless of their ethnic origin, skin colour, religion or belief, gender, national origin, age, disability, sexual identity, marital/family status. **Lighting the way ahead together**
We are family friendly and flexible

title: IT Integrator
description:
In **WB Tech/Transaction Services** we are looking for an IT Integrator (Feature Engineer) to join our **WB TS Reporting & Cards area** team.

 **Your work environment**


Wholesale Banking works conform Agile principles in self-organizing teams. Important aspects of this way of working are initiative, flexibility, continuous development, continuous improvement and active and positive collaboration with other teams.


Our **WB TS Reporting & Cards area** team are responsible for **Global Customer Reporting Platform (GCRP)** services delivery, where *GCRP is the future-proof platform for TS Reporting to ING WB customers*.


You will work in close collaboration with internationally diversified Squads in ING's Agile organization to achieve the QBR commitments. You are also a member of a Feature Engineers Chapter where you work on your craftsmanship.

 **An IT Integrator role in WB TS Reporting & Cards area does the following:**

* Ensures that there are clear business requirements in cooperation with Customer Journey Expert/Business Analyst.
* Ensures that the design is created by the Solution Architect and aligned with the Domain Architect.
* Creates Feature planning, establish cooperation cross Squads and plans Feature delivery; herewith maintaining close relationship with (business) counterpart(s).
* Reviews technical solution directions and technical dependencies drafted in the Epic in coordination with the Business Analyst, the Domain Architect and relevant Squad members, using in-depth IT/application knowledge.
* Facilitates end-to-end testing, to ensure the delivered Feature works as designed and as per the business requirements.
* Combines business and IT knowledge to slice Epics into Features. Having a cross-domain view and identifying needs and dependencies of stakeholders across Tribes or domains.
* Helps shape the feature roadmap in planning sessions towards Vision, Themes and Epics.
* Identifies which Squads/Teams/specialists to involve in the Agile build cycle.
* Challenges and advises Product Owners on Feature dependencies and priorities and backlog alignment of individual Squads.

  

**Who are you?**


**Skills and experience**

* Bachelor's or master's degree.
* Strong leadership skills with a proven track-record of IT Project management & successful delivery in Agile organization WoW.
* 7+ plus years experience in refining and designing features, challenge and advise Product Owners on feature dependencies and priorities.
* Knowledge on databases, Java including APIs, Microservices, Kafka data streaming and possibly Tibco/EMS is a plus.
* Finance/ Payments knowledge, preferably worked within Customer Reporting or Payments area.

 **Competences**

* You are proactive and have a natural drive to act and deliver results on time.
* You are an excellent team player and able to motivate and influence.
* You take initiative, work accurately and in a structured and disciplined manner
* You have the patience and resilience to take it on and make it happen.
* You have a sharp eye for details, while keeping the bigger picture.
* You are highly self-organizing, pragmatic and always seek opportunities to improve.
* You are eager to learn and to keep knowledge up to date.

title: Junior Product Designer
description:
At APC we're looking for a Junior Product Designer to join our team.


Full-time · Amsterdam


**About the job**
-----------------



Amsterdam Platform Creation (APC) created Woolsocks, a new fintech super-app in Europe. Our goal is to help people manage their money smarter, save more, and grow their wealth over time. The Woolsocks app is already available in 7 countries and our user base is rapidly expanding. At APC, we are deeply involved in all aspects of this startup as founders, investors, and consultants. Our experienced and talented team contributes to product management, UX design, development, and marketing to maximize Woolsocks' potential.



What is it like to be a product designer at APC?



Your mission is to make it as easy as possible for our users to explore all money saving opportunities in the Woolsocks platform. Given our diverse user base, spanning multiple countries, cultures, and services in one app, designing for Woolsocks presents an exciting challenge. Are you ready to help people save money?


**Full stack design**  

Your job starts with translating business ideas into valuable, feasible and usable solutions. Since we are a small team of only a few product designers, we expect you to engage in the full spectrum of product design-related activities: conducting various methods of user research to collect insights, UX design, visual design and experimentation.
  

We’re looking for someone who is not afraid to get your hands dirty. You’ll conduct research yourself, design user flows, think about navigation, UX writing, different scenarios and error states. You create prototypes to communicate your solutions and apply and maintain the shared design system together with your peers. Your primary design tool will be Figma, and we utilize Jira, Dovetail, Slack, MS Office, Maze.co, and other tools as well.
  

  

**Insights driven**  

Together with the product managers that you work with, you’ll evaluate the performance of your own solutions and improve and iterate towards the desired business outcomes. You practice a “just enough” research mindset, actively gathering qualitative and quantitative user data when needed. This could be in collaboration with our BI analysts, or you do everything yourself by conducting usability tests, sending user surveys, analysing behavioural data and preparing A/B testing to make insight driven decisions.  

  

**Team**  

You will have the chance to work in a small team with high impact. As a junior designer, you will face a steep learning curve. You will get guidance from experienced team members that help you to define your design activities and together with them you actively communicate with developers and product managers to collect feedback, manage progress of the desired design deliverables and iterate towards the best possible results.
  

You will learn how to articulate your assumptions, argument on your design choices and review your own design work to improve it further. Our teams optimize for maximum value creation, striking a balance between pragmatism/speed and quality.



What We're Looking For


* You have 1-2 years full-time work experience in UX design/product design team;
* There’s no hard requirement to have a university degree but we do expect a certain level of knowledge, analytical skills and creativity. These boxes are automatically ticked with a completed degree in e.g. Digital Design, Interaction Design or Industrial Design, but without these degrees you are just as welcome to apply and tell us about your skills!
* Portfolio showcasing some real-world problems you’ve solved. No case studies please.
* Excellent command of the English language, both written and spoken, as we operate internationally
* You’re living nearby Amsterdam as we love to work together in our beautiful office on the Zuidas.

**Ideally, you have some of the following skills:**


* Native speaker of Dutch, Spanish, French or German is a pré


**You recognize yourself as:**


* A pro-active, strong communicator
* Although you don’t have decades of experience, you are motivated to learn a lot and you’re looking for an environment with a big challenge, and want work in a high-performance environment.
* You are naturally curious about other peoples’ behavior and ability to create a deep understanding of their psych
* You’ve the ability to thrive in a rapidly changing environment while delivering high-quality work. Maintaining an efficient and structured work approach with a keen eye for detail
* You are a true team player who enjoys designing together. You’re open to feedback
* You’ve learned that product design is not an art but a semi-scientific approach to reach business results.
* Gettings-things-done mindset


We Offer:


* Purpose: Make a difference and help people improve their financial well-being.
* An exciting adventure: Join one of the most ambitious fintech startups in Europe.
* Variety: Woolsocks’ wide variety of services ensures every day is different.
* Close to the fire: We’re a small team directly in touch with the CEO and shareholders.
* Work hard, play harder: We get things done and celebrate achievements.
* Competitive compensation
* Phone and laptop from the company
* Attractive pension plan and secondary benefits

  

  

An assessment might be part of the application process

**About you**
=============


* Experience requirement that's an indication of whether it's a senior, medior or junior position
* Specific skill or ability
* Specific skill or ability
* Specific skill or ability
* Soft skill
* Soft skill

title: Chapter lead Finance & Risk Data Domain Azure / Databricks
description:
Chapter lead Finance & Risk Data Domain Azure / Databricks**At a glance**
---------------


Are you a technical expert who inspires others to create innovative and quality solutions? Then we need your help in making ABN AMRO a personal bank in a digital age!  

One of our strategic goals is to become a data-driven organization, so we can get to know our clients even better and serve them in a better way. As a chapter lead, you contribute to these goals by focusing on the IT craftmanship within your department. You stay up-to-date on the latest developments and you mentor your team members in becoming technical experts.  

Our Engineers get the freedom to grow and experiment. You support and guide them so that they can grow their technical expertise that contributes to a future-proof bank. When and where you and your team do your work is up to you! We work hybrid, which means you can flexibly decide where and when you can work most comfortably and effectively.  

As Chapter Lead, you will work at the department Finance & Risk Data domain. We operate on multiple data platforms like the Risk Analytics Platform and the CoDaC Platform, two Azure platforms used for credit risk data modelling purposes and non-financial risk analysis and reporting. Besides that we have platforms for Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) use cases, our FinTax platform to work on Tax authority regulatory requests and we are solving reconciliation challenges with our Finance & Risk Data Domain Store.

**Your job**
------------


You will combine working as Data Engineer with your role as Chapter Lead. About 60% of the time, you will work in your own Scrum Team but also closely with Data Engineers and Data Analysts in other teams on designing and developing future-proof IT solutions of high quality.  

The rest of the time you will manage your chapter.


This includes:

* Educating yourself and others with the right technical capabilities and the latest innovations.
* Mentoring your Chapter members on technical craftsmanship.
* Actively participating in knowledge gaining and sharing by joining triangles, circles, communities and events.
* Proper alignment with stakeholders. For example, informing leadership on the alignment you have with the Solution Engineer on the technological landscape and lifecycle.
* Working in an Agile environment and advocating the Agile and CICD processes.
* You mentor your Chapter, evaluate technical assessments, do interviews and ensure that new employees are properly onboarded.
* Take care of the HR processes to facilitate all aspects relating to the influx, development, performance and outflux of employees.
* Create and foster a healthy working environment and an inclusive culture for your Chapter.
**Working environment**
-----------------------


The Finance & Risk Data Domain is a young department within Finance. We are an ambitious and international group of people. We have embraced an Agile way of working where we strive towards a flat organization with self-organizing teams that have the autonomy to make quick decisions. The atmosphere in the teams and the department is open and informal. You will work in a diverse & inclusive team with many different nationalities, and a good balance in maturity. We work hard, but we also know how to have fun!

  

You will work in a fast paced and accessible environment. We love to share knowledge and to challenge each other, for example by sharing our expertise in our blog, during the events of our Engineering community and by organizing hackathons.

**Your profile**
----------------


You feel at home in a technical environment and are always up to date on the latest technologies. At the same time, you are people-minded and an inspirator. You get enthusiastic from creative and innovative solutions, and you inspire others to get started with these new opportunities.  

Do you think you‘re a fit?


Check your profile:

* Expert in data engineering
* Experienced with cloud solutions and infrastructure (preferably Azure)
* Hands on with building data solutions with Big Data and Orchestration tooling (i.e. Databricks, Spark and Airflow)
* Deep understanding of data processes, data pipelines (ETL), and data lifecycle
* Good understanding of and experience with DevOps and CI/CD practices
* Experience with coaching and mentoring your less experienced team members in their design and development activities
* You have knowledge of and are interested in the latest IT-trends, both within and outside your area of expertise (Cloud, API, Open Banking, CI/CD, SOA, etc.)
* Having relevant certifications like Azure DP-203, PCAP for Python and Databricks Associate Data Engineering is a plus
* Fluent in English
**We are offering**
-------------------


You are given every opportunity and independence to demonstrate your professional expertise in a no-nonsense environment and to further develop yourself. We attach great value to personal development and thereby offer you many training and development opportunities.


In addition:

* A Hay 10-12 salary.
* The freedom to optimize your performance in a flexible working environment.
* Possibilities for flexible working hours and good facilities for remote working.
* A supplementary benefit budget of 11% with which you can buy flexible benefits (including vacation days, mobile phone, (electric) bicycle and additional salary).
* 25 vacation days.
* Apart from the departmental training budget for the department you will receive a personal development budget of € 1.000 per year which can be save up to a maximum of € 3.000.
* An annual public transport pass.
* A generous pension scheme.
* Banking for better days. These are days you can use for your personal development or on which you can contribute to society.
**Interested?**
---------------


Are you interested? Then respond to this vacancy!


We would like to get to know you!

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies must have signed an agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., issued by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, in order to submit CVs. Acquisition is therefore not appreciated.

### **Wij vragen**

* Natuurlijk leiderschap
* Passie voor je vakgebied

title: Senior Product Analyst
description:
**Open in all locations: France, Germany, the Netherlands, and the United Kingdom**

  

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Product Analyst to join our Product team. As a Senior Product Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our platform by leveraging data and insights to drive product development and enhance user experiences. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for enhancement, make informed recommendations, and contribute to the strategic direction of our two sided marketplace platform. This role requires a deep understanding of data analysis, market trends, and a strong ability to work with other analysts in the team to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* **Data Analysis and Insights**
	+ Collect, clean, monitor and analyse data to identify trends, patterns, and user behaviour.
	+ Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for key product metrics.
	+ Conduct A/B tests and experiments to evaluate the impact of product changes.
	+ Provide actionable insights to guide product development and enhancements.
* **Understanding User Behavior**
	+ Deeply understand user behaviour, needs, and pain points on both sides of the marketplace.
	+ Create user personas and journey maps to inform product design and development.
	+ Collaborate with UX/UI designers by providing data-driven insights that can be used to optimise user interfaces
* **Product Strategy**
	+ Collaborate with Product Managers to define product goals and KPIs.
	+ Participate in product roadmapping and prioritise features and improvements based on data analysis.
	+ Assist in defining and tracking success metrics for product launches.
* **Cross-functional Collaboration**
	+ Work closely with Engineers, Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
	+ Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
* **Continuous Learning**
	+ Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis and product analytics.
	+ Continuously improve data collection processes and tools.

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics).
* 5+ years of experience with at least 3+ years of experience as a Product Analyst.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, or R.
* Strong knowledge of data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
* Experience with A/B testing, experiment design, and statistical analysis.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment.
* A passion for data-driven decision-making and product improvement.

### **Why you’ll enjoy working at the Instapro Group**


**You can make an Impact.** Joining Instapro Group is an opportunity to help crack the code in one of the last big industries to become digital-first. We’re leaders in our markets, yet small enough for everyone to make a real difference.


**We care**. We don’t believe in one size fits all. Whether it’s flexibility in your working hours, your location, or opportunities to advance and grow, you’ll find a supportive and open culture designed to help our team members thrive.

  


These are the benefits you'll enjoy:

  

* Highly competitive salary package
* Hybrid work environment
* Hybrid allowance/benefit
* Eligibility to receive an equity award
* Temporary work from abroad policy
* Mental health support
* Regular team and social events
* Further benefits depending on location

  

These are the values that guide everything we do:


* **We put integrity first**. We are authentic, transparent and respectful.
* **We are all stewards.** We are stewards of the company on behalf of all stakeholders.
* **We follow the evidence.** We are objective, evidence-based and pragmatic in our decision-making.
* **We never stop learning.** We are open-minded and curious.
* **We win together.** We collaborate and earn trust with our colleagues.
* **We are inclusive.** We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company.



Read our values in full here

  


Interested in applying? Submit your application below and we will get back to you.

title: Senior Credit Analyst
description:
RiverBank’s mission is to be the digital bank that makes financing to SMEs and Real Estate professionals easy.

From our offices in Amsterdam, Paris and head-office in Luxemburg we act as a niche lending specialist. Our core focus is to grant loans to Small and Medium Enterprises and Real Estate Investors in Europe using a fast, flexible and reliable IT platform.

RiverBank operates under a full and universal European Banking Licence delivering a one-stop shop approach in the entire EU.

The talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team work. RiverBank will offer an entrepreneurial environment within the regulatory banking framework - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. Our culture will promote diversity and individual perspectives in an international environment, represented by more than 15 nationalities.

***Department Profile:***

RiverBank’s credit department selects, analyses and structures loans brought in through our network of distribution partners (e.g. private equity firms, banks, advisory companies and accountants). Whether you’re interested in fintech, financing SME, B2B distribution or working for a high growth firm, RiverBank is the place to be.

The Credit Analyst is responsible for the risk assessment of the credit product including credit analysis, structuring, financial modelling, industry research and negotiation of credit documentation. The Credit Analyst is also responsible for ongoing maintenance of new and existing customers. The aim of the credit team is to build a strong performing portfolio of senior and subordinated loans to SME companies in the Netherlands.

***Primary Responsibilities:***

* Working closely with our origination team
* Analysing credit risk incl. financial modelling and reviewing of due diligence and valuations reports
* Analysing and structuring senior and subordinated loans in the Netherlands and preparing credit proposals to be presented to the Credit Committee
* Attending management meetings
* Negotiating the legal documentation together with the legal department
* Managing ongoing credit needs of existing relationships
* Working with external parties e.g. lawyers, real estate valuators and other relevant market players
* Monitoring of an assigned portfolio of clients; in depth client knowledge is essential for adequately identifying early warning signals with the aim of minimizing credit losses
* Continuously optimizing credit- and credit-related procedures and processes, risk control and IT systems in order to support RiverBank moving forward as a fintech company
* Working closely with Risk, Front Office, Back Office and Management to support sustainable and controlled growth of the credit portfolio while providing lending and structural solutions
* Signaling market trends and propose new loan products

***Skills required:***

* Degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration or other related disciplines
* Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role at a bank, private equity or debt fund
* Relevant prior experience in credit analysis, having deep credit knowledge with sound numerical skills, cash flow analysis and projections proficiency
* Very good knowledge of legal documentation and local relevant law
* Excellent relationship and communication skills, knows how to negotiate a deal between stakeholders
* Team player, lots of energy, thrives in a fast paced environment
* Very organized, effective and efficient, able to prioritize and anticipates business needs
* Proactive and politely assertive when dealing with credit risk issues
* Self-starting and entrepreneurial spirit
* Fluency in Dutch and English

*RiverBank is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximise their full potential. Our skilled and creative workforce is comprised of individuals drawn from a broad cross section of the communities in which we operate and who reflect a variety of backgrounds, talents, perspectives and experiences. Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing and advancing individuals based on their skills and talents.*

*By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data for recruitment purposes. We have a legitimate interest in using the information you provide for the assessment of your suitability for the role. Your data will be used solely for recruitment and will be retained for a maximum of five years. For more information on how we handle your data and your rights, please see our privacy policy at www.riverbank.eu/regulatory-disclosure.*

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Application Question(s):

* Are you eligible to work in the Netherlands?

Experience:

* corporate credit analysis: 5 years (Required)

Language:

* Dutch (Required)
* English (Required)

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:
Equal opportunities for all
  
The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Genuinely surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at New10 can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
  
Your new company
  
We are New10, a financial service scale-up initiated by ABN AMRO Bank. At New10 we believe that business financing should be easy and accessible. Our purpose is to empower businesses to access the funding they need. Though our mission is simple, our ambition is bold: become the #1 engine powering North-West European SMEs.
  
We are on a quest to transform the financing ecosystem by using the speed and innovative strength of a fintech with the expertise and funding of a bank to deliver a fast, simple and clear financing experience to SME businesses. To support our growth towards this ambition, we’re looking for a Medior / Senior Backend Engineer.
  
Your new role
  
* You are someone who can quickly adapt to new situations, with a mindset of continuous learning and improvement
* You are genuinely interested in, and curious about everything – from new technologies and way of working to our customers and their context
* You are driven by data. You embrace creativity and enjoy applying these traits while problem-solving and generating solutions
* You are open-minded, cherish diversity and jump at the opportunity to build a great team together. You are a team player and you know that synergy pays off
* You are a role model to follow in terms of collaboration, accountability, ownership, persistence, integrity, respect and care


**Requirements:**  

We’re looking for someone who has...
  
* Extensive experience with Typescript/Node.js
* Experience with AWS services
* Deep familiarity with GraphQL
* Experience with Styled Components
* Familiarity with serverless architectures
* Experience with common frontend development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc
* In addition to technical skills, the successful applicant should possess durable skills such as emotional intelligence, empathy, communication, (self-)leadership, organisation, time management, presentation skills. These are only some examples.


**Some key characteristics that describe you:**  

* You just love to code and improve every day
* You have years of experience with fast-paced applications and products
* You strive for clean maintainable code and know how to test thoroughly
* You’ve already shifted left on security and quality
* You work comfortably in an agile environment
* You’re pragmatic and have a history of getting things launched
* You’re a self-starter who takes the initiative to seek product improvements


**What you’ll be doing:**  

* Collaborate on architecture, technical design and the building of applications so that together with fellow software engineers you help to improve the team’s competency
* Produce clean, stable, fast and well-architected code
* Own the quality of the code you produce by taking measures to build it in and keep it high. This includes writing unit, integration and E2E tests
* Own and operate the frontend of New10 together with your teammates by rotating through on-call incident management shifts
* Stay up-to-date with the latest technologies
* Closely collaborate and ensure alignment with the rest of the team – backend, Salesforce, PO, business analyst, UX designer and data analyst


**Benefits:**  

At New10 we put our people first. We offer an open, collaborative and supportive working environment and guarantee every New10er that they’ll have a tremendous opportunity for long-term growth and learning. Between the 130 of us, from 25+ different nationalities, we are:
  
* Entrepreneurs ourselves, thinking on our feet and making sure the right things happen
* Genuinely interested and curious, looking to deeply understand our customers and their context
* Driven by data, embracing creativity and exciting technologies
* Open-minded, bringing fresh perspectives and jumping at the opportunity to build an effective team together


We offer
  
* The unique opportunity to grow with a fast-growing fintech scale-up backed by one of the largest banks in the Netherlands
* Gross monthly salary between €5.112 - €8.220 (based on 36 hours) including 8% Holiday Allowance and additional 11% Benefit Budget dependent on experience & skills
* Working-From-Home-Allowance (€3 p/day)
* Great pensions scheme
* €1000,- Annual Development Budget
* Private and Business use of the NS (Dutch Railway) Business Card and Phone Subscription
* Apple Gear for work
* 5 weeks of paid holiday and the possibility to buy more holidays using your Benefit Budget
* Hybrid way of working, balanced with office life and in-person events at our fantastic offices near Amstel Station with nerf guns, hoverboards and table football & events like summer parties, wine tastings, hackathons, winter sports, weekly animal-friendly office day and much more
* The possibility of working from abroad plus access to all Spaces offices worldwide


Interested?
  
Please submit your CV and Cover Letter via the Application button. If your profile looks like a match, we’ll invite you for a first informal conversation with one of our team.
  
  

**Here’s what you can expect about our hiring process:**  

* Step 1: Introduction call with the hiring manager (30 mins)
* Step 2: Experience Interview (60 mins)
* Step 3: Culture interview (60 mins)
* Step 4: Technical case study
* Step 5: Final job offer
* Step 6: Awesome onboarding


Please note that the successful applicant must reside/relocate in The Netherlands prior to the starting date. Additionally, due to banking and compliance requirements, this role requires a background check (which we will organise) to be passed.

title: UX Designer - Interaction Designer
description:
ING is looking for an **Interaction/UX designer** at the Design Center of Expertise.


Are you passionate about design and creating the best digital experience for our customers and employees? If so, you might be the experienced UX Designer we’re looking for at ING’s Design Center of Expertise. You will work closely with your design colleagues and the multidisciplinary teams (squads) and areas you help to create innovative experiences across all of ING’s platforms and products.

**What are you going to do?**

* You work on small and medium digital customer journeys through collaboration with one or more multidisciplinary teams, consisting of business stakeholders, data analysts and developers.
* You know how to talk to and convince senior stakeholders when it comes to design.
* You are inquisitive and have a strong interest in business and tech, preferably in the financial services area.
* You represent the “voice of the customer” in your team(s) and at more senior levels.
* You defend the user centred development of digital concepts and solutions and guard the quality during the delivery process.
* You design and deliver user centred and user experience artefacts.
* You initiate and execute research and data collection aimed at a discovering and validating underlying customer insights, wants and needs. You test and optimise concept designs and can “kill your darlings” based on the outcome.
* You act as well voiced advocate for user experience within your team(s), you increase engagement and business understanding of the value and benefits of design. You communicate research findings, conceptual ideas, and design rationales clearly.

**Where?**  

  

ING is one of the leading retail banks in The Netherlands with more than 8 million customers. We are recognized as a leader in digital banking and innovation. Our main digital channels are our native apps (iOS/Android) and our secure internet banking environment. We take pride in the appreciation we receive from our customers with regards to the quality of our user experience and the ease of use of our channels.


The Design CoE is the home for all digital designers at ING The Netherlands. At the CoE, 43 designers work in 10 Expert Teams led by 1 CoE Lead and 3 Expert Leads. Our offices are in Amsterdam Zuid-Oost.

  

We are experts in Service design, User Experience design, Interaction design, Visual design, Content design and User research. At the Design CoE we are building and developing a high-quality user experience and design practice. We initiate and document best practice design methodology, patterns, annotations, and the creation of high-fidelity design artefacts. Together with the design departments in other ING countries we co-develop and use the global ING design system.  

  

Together with Business and IT, we are committed to deliver the best digital experience for todays and tomorrows customer. We design digital customer journeys focused on overview, transaction, self-service, and products/sales. Increasingly, we help our customers with financial management and financial health related digital journeys.  



What are we looking for?

* You are a graduate of a University (MA)-, or University of applied Arts (BA) in a digital design related field.
* You have at least 5 years of relevant digital design experience.
* You have a strong and creative digital portfolio with examples of work in both interaction and user experience design and a very convincing story to back it up.
* You base your designs on data and insights and take a pro-active approach. You ask critical questions, always.
* You have advanced knowledge on design techniques and subjects such as information architecture, task-flow models, UI specs, design specs, wireframing, prototyping and user-centred design.
* You have thorough experience in designing for mobile/tablet devices.
* You know all the relevant ins and outs of designing for accessibility (A11Y) and how to apply this in your daily work.
* You have broad understanding, skill and experience in setting up and conducting user research.
* You have expert skills and extensive experience in working with design tooling: Figma and Maze are our tools of the trade, knowledge of Photoshop and Illustrator is a nice to have. We expect you to be curious to know more about the future of design tooling and take an active interest.
* You are fluent in English (speaking, reading and writing).

**What do we offer?**

* Working and learning in a highly motivated team of professionals in a dynamic environment.
* Salary tailored to your professional qualities and experience.
* Pre-paid mobility card takes care of all modern means of (public) transport for travelling to and from the office.
* 50%/50% work in the office/work from home (or more in the office if you like).
* 24 vacation days with a 36-hour working week.
* Pension scheme.
* 13th month salary.
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary.
* 8% holiday payment

**About Us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse, and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Sr. Payroll Compliance Analyst
description:
**Work Schedule**


Other**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**


We have 3 Sr. Payroll Compliance Analyst (Center of Excellence / EMEA) positions open. We are seeking payroll authorities with extensive payroll compliance and audit experience for a subset of countries: Netherlands, Belgium and the Nordic countries.


These colleagues will possess recent and sustained knowledge of their country portfolio compliance (payroll, benefits, tax & audit) and report into our Global Payroll Audit function. This critical role functions as the liaison between the business units, legal, tax authorities, technical teams, vendors, external consultants, internal/external auditors and most importantly, Thermo Fisher colleagues. Serving as a multi-country compliance authority, the Sr. Payroll Compliance Analyst (CoE / EMEA) gathers business requirements, translates them into a working set of functional requirements, applies and participates in industry standard testing methodologies while ensuring a successful transition to production. It is critical that this role maintain current on local legislation, compliance, and regulatory changes for a defined group of approximately 1-4 countries (depending on population size and country complexity).


In addition, the Sr. Payroll Compliance Analyst (CoE / EMEA) has input into country specific projects, task development, and implementation planning around business requirements and testing needs. The Sr. Payroll Compliance Analyst (CoE / EMEA) is also responsible for creating test plans, test scripts and performing user acceptance testing. This visible role will possess the ability to effectively assess business needs, technical and functional requirements, and constraints, as well as the compatibility between different application components. Documenting payroll solutions within defined GBS standards is critical to sustaining investments in payroll. Implementations and large-scale change requests will require appropriate support from the Sr. Payroll Compliance Analyst (CoE / EMEA) until the change is sustained. Heavy participation in internal/external audits. Raises potential risk appropriately to management as needed.

**Other Functions**

* Support of multi-country compliance & configuration
* Business analysis
* Implementation/System upgrade coordination, testing and QA
* Change Request management
* Support regional/global initiatives; execution of process/continuous improvement
* Support International Assignee population (hypo tax, data collection, etc.)
* Conduct legislation reviews on a monthly/quarterly basis to ensure compliance
* Participate in and/or lead internal/external audits
* Vendor management
* Colleague support as needed
* Assist Payroll operations as time permits

**Experience:**

* Extensive payroll experience with advanced HR, Finance and/or IT experience required
* Working in a Shared Services environment
* Implementations support for at least 2 countries onto a new operating platform
* Collaborator & Vendor management
* Integrations domain authority
* Mergers & Acquisition experience
* Data Collection/Conversions
* Time & Attendance knowledge
* Implementation/System upgrade coordination, testing and QA
* Proficient knowledge of GL - ability to recon & fix
* Advanced analytical skills
* Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Suite (excel, word, etc.)
* Experienced knowledge of country and localized payroll legislation
* Additional Competencies:
* Stellar verbal and written communication skills
* Self-starter able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
* Strong organization skills
* Great Teammate

**Other Re****quirements:**

* Proficient in English and Dutch (speak & write)
* Work schedule may require alignment to different time zones based on the needs of the business
* Ability to work in an appropriate manner with confidential data
* Experience with Workday & SAP Payroll Engine
* Travel up to 25%

**What we offer:**
------------------

* Direct contract with Thermo Fisher Scientific with a competitive salary, 13th month, holiday allowance and annual incentive bonus
* A flexible working hours arrangement
* Excellent career progression opportunities within a growing global employer
* Training and courses available via Thermo Fisher University to develop yourself
* Collaborative work in an international environment
* Strong Team Spirit and many company and team activities
* Very attractive 40 holidays a year
* This is a full-time position (40 hours). Working part-time is an option in case you’re available for at least 32 hours.


We welcome candidates that enjoy working in a diverse, multi-disciplinary, groundbreaking technology environment where personal development and team cooperation are key to success, to make the impossible possible for our customers..


Diversity in our teams is an important element to build an effective and challenging working environment. Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement are key values that we expect of all that are part of our community.

**Please apply today!** http://jobs.thermofisher.com


Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Business Developer II (ALM/Treasury)
description:
Business Developer II (ALM/Treasury)**At a glance**
  

  

Are you a professional who enjoys working on the interface between content and IT? Are you able to fathom complex matters in order to make the right translation between business and IT? Do you get energy from advising and convincing stakeholders of your proposals, and are you able to show execution power during implementation? Then this role might be the perfect match for you!
  

  

At ABN AMRO we are looking for a hands-on, results-driven Business Analyst / Data Analyst to join our Asset & Liability Management (ALM) Grid department. ALM can be described as a bank within the bank, as our department sits at the heart of the bank and is responsible for managing the bank's balance sheet in terms of interest rate, liquidity, and capital risks.
  

  

You'll be joining a team of versatile engineers and business developers, and together you will be responsible for managing and improving ALM data processes and applications in an Agile and DevOps environment to deliver insights and reports for our stakeholders, who include the Board of Directors and other business segments of the bank, as well as external supervisory authorities like the DNB and ECB. Next to this, you will be involved in preparing and aligning the current solutions of your department to the Finance & Risk future target architecture and IT solution.
  

  

**Your work**
  

  

As a Business Analyst / Data Analyst, you are able to look at ALM challenges through the eyes of a stakeholder. You will work on multiple projects where you will initiate, improve and implement the processes, systems and data that your team is responsible for, with the focus on data analysis. You will be able to advise and convince stakeholders of the best approach based on your knowledge and analytical expertise, and work closely with other business and IT developers to achieve the goals of the ALM department.
  

  

**Work environment**
  

  

The ALM Grid department is a diverse, dynamic and international environment. The ALM Grid consists of seven teams which are mainly organized according to the risk type domains (Interest Rate Risk, Liquidity Risk, Funds Transfer Pricing) and the data domain. You will be working in the data domain teams supporting the risk type teams with their data needs. We have an open and social culture, and value interpersonal at least as much as business and technical skills. You will get to work in:  

  

  

* One of the front-running departments of ABN AMRO that takes pride in delivering robust and manageable future-proof solutions using the latest IT standards and technologies
* A multidisciplinary and multicultural self-organizing Agile-Scrum DevOps team (typically 5-9 people per team) that enjoys close cooperation with its stakeholders
* An open and highly autonomous culture where you are responsible for your goals and encouraged to regularly give and receive feedback
* An informal atmosphere with plenty of room for fun (movie/gaming events, team outings & monthly drinks)

  

The stakeholder field of the ALM Grid mainly consists of the ALM department itself, 2nd line ALM, ALM Risk modelling, Risk Reporting and Model Validation. Also, the data sources delivering parties are important stakeholders. In addition, your stakeholders are also the parties which consume the data to meet internal and external requirements. The final ALM reports, insights and analyses are discussed in senior management bodies like ALCO, BRC and ERM.
  

  

**Your profile**
  

  

We are looking for someone with a proactive and constructively critical attitude who is not afraid to tackle challenges head on. Besides a healthy knowledge/interest in complex and analytical matters (which characterizes ALM), you should possess the following skill-set:
  

  

* HBO / University education
* 2 (or more) years of work experience
* Strong communicator with excellent command of English (both verbal and written)
* Knowledge of banking products and/or ALM processes
* Knowledge of data processing management and ETL
* Experience with Excel, SQL, and/or similar data analysis tools
* Analytical mindset and the ability to quickly grasp complex business flows at a high level
* Supporting and collaborating with stakeholders and other departments
* Drive to improve self and the team
* Organizational sensitivity and able to adopt different styles to optimize effectiveness
* Taking ownership and guide the development team in the right direction

  

We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all the criteria.
  

  

**We offer**
  

  

A challenging environment offering you the possibility to develop yourself, both context wise regarding the ALM field of expertise, as well as on a personal/ professional level. You will work in the heart of the bank where it all comes together.  

  

  

* The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
* A competitive salary, including vacation pay and benefit budget, based on a 36-hour work week (40-hr work week is possible)
* A Benefit Budget which is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month
* A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3.000
* 25 days of vacation per year (Based on 40hr work week)
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position)
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands
* An excellent pension scheme

  

**Interested?**
  

  

Do not hesitate to approach us for more details, or apply directly! For more information you can contact Asli Aydogdu (Product Owner Data) via asli.aydogdu@nl.abnamro.com or Joost Arendsen (ALM Domain Lead a.i.) joost.arendsen@nl.abnamro.com. We are looking forward to meet you!
  

  

**Equal opportunities for all**
  

  

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
  

  

**Disclaimer external recruitmentagencies**
  

  

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.
  

  

Lees meer
  

  

**Wie zijn je collega's?**
  

  

"Aan het begin van de coronacrisis hoefde een groot deel van onze klanten tijdelijk geen rente en aflossing over hun lening te betalen. Het voelt goed om ondernemers die het zwaar hebben te helpen."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Sander Cremers**
  

Portfolio Manager Financial Risk
  

  

"De financiële gegevens van alle afdelingen bundelen we tot begrijpelijke rapportages. Zo adviseren we het management over de financiële positie van het bedrijf."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Rosalie Tulen**
  

Junior Controller
  

  

"Je merkt heel duidelijk dat ABN AMRO in beweging is. Er zijn continu nieuwe projecten aan de gang, waarvan een groot deel met duurzaamheid te maken heeft."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Niels Vlaming**
  

Reporting Specialist
  

  

"Er is met data nu véél meer mogelijk dan een paar jaar geleden. Daar ligt de uitdaging voor mij."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Joep Timmermans**
  

Junior Accounting Data Analist
  

  

"De manier van denken is belangrijker dan direct alle antwoorden paraat te hebben. Het gaat er meer om wat je doet als je de antwoorden niet hebt."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Anna Zadorozhnaia**

title: Software Developer (Mid-level)
description:
SOFTWARE DEVELOPER (MID-LEVEL)
Faber LABS
 * Veemarktkade 8, 's-Hertogenbosch

  
Hey software developer. Are you ready to transform the world of supply chain forever? Nice to meet you, we are Faber LABS. A brand new division of the Faber Group that is launched to digitalize our load carrier business. With endless possibilities for making supply chains more sustainable, transparent and efficient, but about all future proof. We’re looking for skilled software engineers to help us develop our digital products portfolio and achieve our goals. Want to be part of our journey?! Who are we? We are Faber LABS, member of the family-owned Faber Group. At Faber LABS we aim to accelerate digital transformation within logistic supply chains, making them more sustainable, transparent and efficient. Driven by data combined with years of knowledge of supply chains, we will transform the logistic landscape forever. Our goal? Going from your regular load carrier to data-driven load carriers with automated processes and data-driven decision-making that enables us to carry more impact. The possibilities are endless. Are you up for the challenge?

Who you are



As our Software developer, we’re looking for…


* A bachelor’s or master degree in Computer Science, Software engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
* 3+ years of professional experience in software development.
* Proven experience in React, .net core / C# and Python.
* A keen eye for details & a problem solving mindset
* Of course you are a technical genius, but your also communicative, confident and you take initiative
* A team player with a sense of humor


What we offer



Just as you give your best, we do too. We’re all about a work-life balance, making sure you can be all-in your work, while being all-in with your hobbies, sportive activities or time with family and friends.


* A competitive salary - 4.243,82 to 5.246,91 euro per month depending on experience and skills;
* Everything you need to excel at your job: e.g. laptop and phone
* A hybrid way of working: from our modern office in ‘s Hertogenbosch or your home office;
* Flexible workhoursA lot of freedom and responsibility within the team
* Continuous growth opportunities;
* Inspiring colleagues with creative, analytical and innovative minds from across the globe;
* A chance to build a whole new team, within a brand-new company.


**Our role as Full Stack Developer**
You might have noticed that we have big digital ambitions. As a Software Developer, you'll become member of a product team, working closely with other developers, UX/UI designers, and analysts, all led by a Product Owner. As a mid-level Software Developer, you play a crucial role within the team. You’ll be responsible for the technical quality of the software and serve as a valuable partner to the Product Owner in brainstorming and developing solutions.

title: Business Analyst
description:
BUSINESS ANALYST
Faber LABS
 * Veemarktkade 8, 's-Hertogenbosch

  
Hey, Business Analyst. Are you ready to change the world of supply chain forever? Nice to meet you, we are Faber LABS. A brand-new division of Faber Group that is launched to digitalize our load carrier business models. With endless possibilities for making supply chains more sustainable, transparent and efficient, but above all future proof. We need your Business Analyst skills to help build up this new company and achieve our goals. Challenge accepted? Your role as Business Analyst Maybe you noticed, but we have big ambitions. So, you, as Business Analyst, will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions, ensuring that our products meet market demands and drive business growth. To ensure we meet this target, you will be working closely alongside our Product Owners. Within your role you will be responsible for gathering and analysing data, defining requirements, preparing decision making and supporting the Product Owner in the product development lifecycle, so we can achieve our goals, together. Who are we? We are Faber LABS, member of the family-owned Faber Group. At Faber LABS we aim to accelerate digital transformation within logistic supply chains, making them more sustainable, transparent and efficient. Driven by data combined with years of knowledge of supply chains, we will transform the logistic landscape forever. Our goal? Going from your regular load carrier to data-driven load carriers with automated processes and data-driven decision-making that enables us to carry more impact. The possibilities are endless. Are you up for the challenge?

Who you are



We’re looking for…

What we offer



Just as you give your best, we do too. We’re all about a work-life balance, making sure you can be all-in your work, while being all-in with your hobbies, sportive activities or time with family and friends.


* A competitive salary of 3.800 to 4.700 euro per month depending on skills and experience;
* Everything you need to excel at your job: e.g. laptop and phone
* A hybrid way of working: from our modern office in ‘s Hertogenbosch or your home office;
