* A lot of freedom and responsibility within the team
* Continuous growth opportunities;
* Inspiring colleagues with creative, analytical and innovative minds from across the globe;
* A chance to build a whole new team, within a brand-new company.


* Collaborate with Product Owners
  

o Work in tandem with the Product Owner to define product requirements, user stories and use cases.
* Requirement Gathering
  

o Conduct detailed business analysis, outlining problems, opportunities, and solutions for the business.
* Stakeholder Communication
  

o Engage with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into actionable requirements.
* Documentation
  

o Create comprehensive documentation, including business requirements documents (BRDs), user stories, and use cases.
* Data Analysis
  

o Analyse data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform product decisions.
  

Support Development Teams
  

o Work closely with development teams to ensure requirements are understood and implemented correctly.
* User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
  

o Coordinate and support UAT activities to ensure the final product meets the business needs.
* Market Research
  

o Conduct market research to stay updated on industry trends and competitor products.
* Continuous Improvement
  

o Identify areas for improvement in product processes and workflows.

title: KYC Subject Matter Officer (Quality Reviewer) - Private Equity
Data Engineer
description:
**Data Engineer**  

*Rotterdam, 40 hours per week*  

  

**Your role in our network**  

We at Viterra are excited to announce an opening for a Data Engineer within our Data and Analytics team. This role is a cornerstone in driving the data-centric initiatives that empower our traders and stakeholders with real-time, actionable insights in the dynamic agricultural commodity trading market.  

  

As a Data Engineer, you will be an integral part of our Data and Analytics (D&A) team. Your primary focus will be leveraging your expertise in modern data engineering tools and practices, including dbt, Snowflake, Tableau, Git, DevOps, and TFS, to develop robust data solutions. Additionally, your knowledge of Oracle will be valuable for managing and transitioning from our legacy data warehouses.  

  

*We have currently set our scope to include candidates who already live and work in the Netherlands (this with regard to our company policy to work at the office HQ Rotterdam 3 days a week)*  

  

**In this role, your responsibilities will include:**
* Designing and developing efficient data pipelines.
* Optimizing and managing high-performance databases, with a focus on Snowflake and a secondary emphasis on Oracle for legacy systems.
* Transforming complex data sets into meaningful business intelligence.
* Creating scalable data models and architectures.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions.


  

**What will you do?**
* Develop and maintain advanced data pipelines using tools like dbt, ensuring effective data integration into Snowflake and Oracle databases.
* Optimize and update data models and architectures for performance and scalability, with an emphasis on modern systems and a consideration for legacy Oracle databases.
* Work closely with business stakeholders and the D&A team to develop efficient data solutions that meet business needs.
* Implement and manage data visualization and reporting tools, primarily using Tableau.
* Uphold data integrity and apply version control and DevOps methodologies for streamlined data operations.


  

**What we offer**
* A competitive salary and an annual bonus scheme, based on company results and your performance.
* An additional full month’s salary each year as an annual holiday allowance.
* Exciting opportunities to progress your career within our international network.
* A flexible and attractive pension scheme, fully funded by Viterra.
* A challenging position within a world-leading, fully integrated agriculture network.
* A professional and stimulating environment in which enthusiastic and driven colleagues work together in a practical and informal way.
* 27 days of annual leave, including Good Friday and one flexible day during the Christmas and New Year period.
* Access to a range of free and exclusive classes to improve your physical and mental wellbeing as part of Viterra’s Vitality programme.
* Tailored learning & development opportunities.
* A modern, open and inspiring office in the centre of Rotterdam, next to the Markthal and Blaak station.
* Complimentary daily lunch service from our Viterra restaurant.
* Options for flexible working, in accordance with our working from home policy.
* Business laptop.
* Reimbursement of travel to work (via public transport).


  

**Who are we looking for?**
* Holds a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in IT or a related field.
* Has a minimum of 5 years of experience in data engineering, preferably in the commodity trading industry.
* Is proficient in dbt, Snowflake, Tableau, Git, DevOps, and TFS, with additional knowledge of Oracle as a plus.
* Demonstrates strong analytical skills and a business-focused mindset.
* Communicates effectively in English, both in speaking and writing.
* Is committed to our core values and contributes to our diverse and inclusive culture


  

**What happens next?**  

1. Your application  

Thank you for your application! You can expect to receive a call from us within 2 working days. We're excited to learn more about you and if we see a fit with the organization, we'll invite you for a digital interview. Apply now via **the application form** on our website.  

  

2. (Digital) interview  

The first interview is a chance to get to know each other and determine whether there is a potential fit for moving forward in the hiring process.  

  

3. Interview at Viterra  

Depending on the position, a second or possibly even a third interview or business case may be scheduled, during which we'll welcome you at our headquarters in Rotterdam. Additionally, a reference check and integrity screening by a third party are part of our procedure.  

  

4. The offer  

If we're excited to have you join our team and you're still enthusiastic about Viterra, you'll receive an offer.  

  

5. Welcome in the team  

We're excited to have you on board and can't wait to start working together.  

  

**Recruiter**  

Kris Bhageloe; **kris.bhageloe@careersatviterra.com** or +31682098257.  

  

**Who we are**  

We believe in the power of connection. Our world-leading, fully integrated agriculture network connects producers and consumers to supply sustainable, traceable and quality-controlled agricultural products.  

  

With our talented people, decades of experience and diverse capabilities, we offer innovative solutions to open pathways and create value for customers through our supply chains.  

  

As a responsible long-term business, we will continue to invest in and develop our network, allowing us to meet the needs of a growing world.  

  

**What do we stand for?**  

We believe that a workforce made up of colleagues from different backgrounds, cultures and beliefs can only make us stronger.  

  

We value diversity and work inclusively to bring together many minds, many talents and many perspectives. We offer a work environment where colleagues receive fair and equal opportunities to progress their career at Viterra.  

  

We welcome all applicants regardless of age, gender, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social origin or any other characteristic.  

  

*Agency calls are not appreciated.*

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Senior Data Scientist**At a glance**
---------------


ABN is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to improve our customers experience providing a more personalized touch in their day-to-day banking.


**Your job**
------------


The candidate is expected to fulfil the following responsibilities fully independent and with great ownership.  

* Design the analysis: explicitly plan the analysis, anticipate and address competing explanation, determine the best way to evaluate the intended results.
* Conduct analysis: wrangle and explore the data appropriately, visualize and present the exploration results; develop/apply and devise appropriate algorithms; work as a thought data and algorithms lead; identify and integrate new datasets that can be leveraged through the product capabilities; work closely with the data engineering team to strategize and execute the development of data products; help solve various problems and make a true impact across various business units and domains.
* Business implementation: Discover the needs of the business/user; package technical work for diverse audiences; navigate the business organization structure; build a business network ; communicate analytic solutions to stakeholders and implement improvements as needed to operational systems.
* Engineering integration: Develop data pipelines from and to different (cloud and no-cloud) locations; make work compatible with the operationalisation stack; apply hands-on knowledge of the MLOps practices; co-create solution architectures; bring analytical models into production by collaborating with the engineers, co-create solution architectures.
* Way of working (WoW): Shape and enforce the WoW of the team and align it with other teams; work independently; collaborate with others; continuous improvement mindset; Lead complex use case: Lead complex projects, particularly XFN (cross-functional) projects; helping and influencing the grids (tribes) in the business line and the business units to prioritize their roadmap for more data driven solutions.
* Build the profession: Present in internal meetings and knowledge sharing sessions, as well as external conferences, meetups, workshops, encourage the team and staff; able to mentor and lead other data scientists.
**Working environment**
-----------------------


The CoE is a comprehensive data & analytics team part of Customer and Digital Experience (CDE) in ABN AMRO. Within Customer & Digital Experience the online platforms are being created and built that offer all the digital products of ABN AMRO. All these developments and products are powered by the data & analytics of our CoE.  

  

We strongly believe that online banking should be easier, faster, more delightful, and more personal to create sustainable long-term relationships with our customers. To do so, we develop suitable solutions that give our customers greater financial control. With a vast amount of data at hand, together with our unique usability lab as test-station we build digital services in an agile way that surprise customers and help them move forward. At Customer & Digital Experience you get the freedom and responsibility to improve our products & services. In other words, we encourage you to release your creativity and put it into practice. The environment is similar to a start-up atmosphere - feel free to wear your sneakers.

**Your profile**
----------------


The ideal candidate is expected to:  

* Have a master’s degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, statistics; econometrics or related field;
* 7+ years of relevant industry experience
* Be able to analyse problems and strategize for better solutions
* Be comfortable in both a leadership and team-player role
* Be a creative problem solver who thrives when presented with a challenge
* Be goal-oriented, organized team player
* Good interpersonal skills and communication
* Expert in a wide arsenal of statistical, machine learning, deep learning and operation research techniques to help solve different classes of problems; having a deep knowledge of the models, their pitfall, knowing what types of transformations work best with them, being able to recommend, coach and convince other data scientists on the right technical approach, being able to balance between the model quality and the speed of delivery;
* *Must have experience in defining and running experiments in the context of online marketing, being able to draw causal reasoning, evaluate the results and present to business stake holders;*
* Comfort working in a dynamic environment with several ongoing concurrent projects; able to prioritize, and manage time effectively
* Experience with coaching and mentoring junior data scientists
* Up-to-date on the latest industry trends; able to articulate trends and potentials clearly and confidently
* Proficiency in using SQL, Python and PySpark.
* Knowledge of at least one of the cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP)
* Experience in Banking and/or e-Commerce is a plus.
**We are offering**
-------------------


We offer you a challenging position in a professional environment in which you get the opportunity to be the best version of yourself. You will be able to gain a lot of knowledge of the financial field and further develop your data science skills. We also offer the possibility to follow general and (specific) data science trainings. We offer you excellent terms of employment and benefits:  

* A good monthly salary based on a 40-hour working week
* A position that offers a lot of opportunities for professional development
* The ability to work flexibly
* We help you to stay fit & vital
* An additional benefit budget of 11%, with which you can buy flexible terms of employment
* A personal development budget of € 1,000 per year
* An annual public transport ticket for unlimited travel
* A good pension scheme
* A great organization with a great work culture
* Interesting work and challenging projects
* A team that likes to help, supplement and strengthen each other
**Interested?**
---------------


Are you interested? Please respond to this vacancy now. For more information about the role, please contact Valerio Ciotti, Team Lead Data Science (valerio.ciotti@nl.abnamro.com). For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Nicay Hertogs (nicay.hertogs@nl.abnamro.com).

 **The interview process**

 *In the application we expect the candidate to highlight in their cover letter relevant experience of implementation of previous experiments and use cases.*


First interview (1 hour): we will get to know each other during the first interview. Aim of the interview is to assess the level of seniority and the fit with the team. We will also spend some time explaining what we are working on.


Second interview (1 hour): There is a take home assignment. This is a modelling/data analysis, machine learning assignment designed to take a couple of hours to complete. Based on the outcome of the use case, we will invite you to present your results and test your technical knowledge on ML and statistics.


Third interview (45 min): Cultural fit and your interest in working in ABN.

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij vragen**

* Goede communicatie vaardigheden

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: IT System Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
Patagonia is an outdoor apparel company founded in 1973. At a time when all life on earth is under threat of extinction, we aim to use the resources we have—our business, our investments, our voice and our imagination—to influence changes needed to protect our planet. A registered B Corporation and founding member of 1% for the Planet, Patagonia is recognised internationally for its commitment to product quality and environmental activism, contributing over $145 million in grants and in-kind donations to thousands of grassroots environmental groups around the world.

**Your role:**  

We are in business to save our home planet. Your role will contribute to this purpose by designing and developing our systems, ensuring the highest levels of availability, performance and security.


The IT Systems Engineer is responsible for overseeing and maintaining all infrastructure and system installations, including configuration, testing, and ongoing maintenance. This role is also involved in the implementation and management of backups, security measures, and redundancy strategies.


Additionally, the IT Systems Engineer proactively identifies potential issues, develops and integrates effective solutions, and creates custom scripts to automate processes, thereby enhancing efficiency and supporting smarter business operations while managing our third-party vendors.

 **Main tasks:**

* Support the implementation of global technological strategies and collaborate with the International IT Team and third-party vendors.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and define system requirements while overseeing third-party vendors and contractors for outsourced work, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of services.
* Manage and optimize systems to ensure high availability, efficient resource utilization, and effective device management, while maintaining security policies.
* Streamline and automate processes and monitoring using scripting technologies.
* Provide technical guidance and support for new applications and services during onboarding.
* Install and configure operating systems, software, and hardware components, and document design, maintenance, and support procedures for routine tasks to empower IT support staff.
* Regularly test software for bugs, redundancies, and security issues, and conduct comprehensive vulnerability management to ensure the environment remains up-to-date and compliant with industry frameworks (e.g., PCI-DSS, CIS).
* Provide Tier 2 and 3 support for IT Helpdesk, assist users with support issues, and serve as backup for IT Helpdesk and IT Systems Administrator functions and lead Tier 4 escalation, where required.
* Perform high-level root-cause analysis for service interruptions and establish preventive measures while outlining findings and solutions with proper documentation;
* Manage the backup strategy and oversee daily operations for secure backups and restore testing.
* Oversee the lifecycle and maintenance of networking and server equipment across EMEA HQ, regional offices, and retail locations.
* Integrate and harmonize technology trends from US HQ with EMEA needs.

 **What we’re looking for:**

* 3-5 years of experience in computer engineering, systems administration, engineering support, or consulting
* Industry certifications preferred (e.g., Microsoft, Cloud environments, etc.)
* Hands-on experience with Palo Alto and Cisco technologies
* Experience with monitoring/or log ingestion platforms is preferred (Datadog)
* Proven expertise in Microsoft Azure and related technologies
* Experience in vendor management and stakeholder management
* Strong understanding of networking concepts, including LAN/WAN, TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, routers, switches, and wireless access points and firewalls
* Fluent English is a must, other languages a plus
* Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Able to work well under pressure and with multiple project deadlines
* Ability to switch between projects and specific day-to-day responsibilities
* Self-motivated, self-starter, detail-oriented, good follow-through, and able to meet deadlines
* Interest in environmental issues and outdoor activities

 **Other important details:**

* This is a full time position, based in Amsterdam.
* We have a hybrid work model, working from home for maximum 3 days per week
* We strive to make unbiased decisions and to offer a great experience to every person who applies for a role at Patagonia. Our interviews include standardised questions that focus on the aspects that are important for success in the role. For some roles there will also be a practical assignment, where you can showcase your skills
* To find out more about what we offer our employees click here: **https://eu.patagonia.com/nl/en/what-we-offer/**


At Patagonia, we commit to becoming an anti-racist company that leads by example. This means doing the work to be inclusive and equitable, across all aspects of our business.


Every person who applies to join Patagonia receives equal employment opportunities, and we value a welcoming environment where each member of our EMEA team feels included, respected and empowered, regardless of their race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, civil status, national origin, disability or age.


At Patagonia, we strive to have inclusive representation within our organisation and embrace a diverse mix of talent to contribute to our culture. We actively seek applications from Black and People of Colour (BPOC) and other underrepresented groups.


As we are in business to save our home planet, we can only do this together.

**Please make sure that your CV and cover letter are in English.**

**Disclaimer for recruitment agencies:**


Thanks for your interest in supporting us for this role, but we don’t accept unsolicited CVs from recruitment agencies

title: Procurement Business Partner, IGT-Systems
description:
### **Job Title**


Procurement Business Partner, IGT-Systems### **Job Description**

**In this role, as Procurement Business Partner for** **the** **IGT Systems** **(Image Guided Therapy Systems)** **you will be** responsible for developing and managing the procurement strategy that supports the IGT System’s objectives in alignment with the Philips enterprise supplier and category strategy. This includes cost savings initiatives, quality goals achievement, increase the resilience of the supply chain, localization, quality & regulatory, sustainability policies, track cost and performance KPIs, new product introduction (NPI) and manage the team (located in Netherlands, India and China). You will lead and manage all Procurement activities for the global IGT Systems Organization driving sourcing decisions and supplier performance from early product development to mass production, to enable this you will be expected to have a deep understanding of the BU strategy, product portfolio, supplier market and strong connection with the leaders within the IGT Systems organization.

**About IGT Systems (Image Guided Therapy Systems)**

Philips IGT Systems is the global leading innovator in the image-guided interventional field. As a leader in image-guided therapy, we have been driving continuous innovation to address rising patient volumes and increased procedure complexity.


We develop seamlessly integrated health systems, including interventional X-ray systems and software solutions, that enable physicians to treat patients with personalized and minimally invasive procedures. We design to optimize system integration and lab performance, that supports our customers in maintaining high standards of quality and patient care at predictable costs. Within IGT Systems, we have Fixed and Mobile Surgery (MoS) solutions that serve our customer needs.

**You are responsible for**

* Creating strategic impact by initiating, organizing, and implementing of Procurement strategies, programs and transformations for IGT Systems.
* Establishing a collaborative culture related to Procurement (all 3rd party spend in BoM, Markets and spend management) exemplified by openness, trust, shared action, and an emphasis on mutual long-term benefits.
* Develop and deploy procurement strategies in the Business.
* Provide Procurement leadership and vision to enable the organization’s short- and long-term objectives.
* Achieves product and value chain optimization by cross-functional cooperation within the business.
* Ensures that the Procurement related risks (cost, quality, availability) are controlled and mitigated.
* Capture supplier innovation in product and business creation to optimize propositions and achieve the best value for Philips and its customers.
* Ensures commodity and category strategies are relevant for the business, aligned with cross-functional stakeholders and fully implemented in the Business Unit.
* Lead a team of procurement engineers who liaise with commodity managers to deliver procurement expertise and deliverables to the product development teams on a daily basis.
* Driving all procurement activities related to New Product Introduction (NPI) in the BU. Orchestrating the sourcing and industrialization with innovative suppliers, ensuring the successful completion of NPI Phase Gates. Managing Cost, Quality (APQP) and Risk with a strong focus on patient safety and product quality.
* Responsible for talent management of the procurement function.

**You are part of**


A member of the Procurement & Engineering Organization within the Global Integrated Supply Chain and directly reports to the Head of Procurement & Engineering within the Global Integrated Supply Chain.

**To succeed in this role,** **you’ll need a customer-first attitude and the following -**

* Master’s in business administration and relevant training in SPM and Supply chain preferred.
* At least 10 years of experience in Procurement, Supply Chain or in related Stakeholder function
* Cultural sensitiveness, able to do global business across Europe, the Americas and Asia.
* Works on complex issues where analysis of situations requires an in-depth knowledge of the company.
* Strategic thinker with a ‘can do’ attitude. Result driven, with a proven track record.
* Understanding of suppliers, business models, key drivers, measures, priorities and make or buy decisions.
* Expertise in Design for eXcellence and Value Engineering.
* Team player with excellent analytic and communication skills.
* Ability to influence and challenge stakeholders both externally and internally is key.
* Experience in LEAN or Six Sigma is considered an advantage.

**In return, we offer you**


The ability to collaborate with, learn and grow from colleagues in a highly matrixed global organization where you can use your strengths to help drive strategic business initiatives for Philips. Additionally, we provide you a dynamic working environment in an innovative business, paired with a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and a supportive atmosphere where you can sharpen your talents with new challenges and career opportunities.


Our benefits can be found here: https://www.careers.philips.com/na/en/total-rewards-at-philips.

**How we work at Philips**


Our newly adopted hybrid work concept fuses flexibility with collaboration to deliver great outcomes for our people and our customers. We are embracing an approach wherein we spend more time together than apart – which for full-time employees translates to an average of at least 3 days working from the office and up to 2 days from home – for our hybrid roles.


Hybrid work flexibility means people can meet the changing demands of work and home in the most balanced, productive, and healthy way.


Our hybrid working model is defined in 3 ways:


*We believe in the importance of impactful collaboration:* There's a certain energy when everyone’s in the same room that can heighten idea generation and creative friction needed for problem-solving.

*We embrace flexibility:* Choosing where, when, and how to work can vary according to task and team schedules. Flexibility isn’t office or online, it means choosing the space that works best for you, your teams, and our customers on a case-by-case basis.


*We want to be at our best:* The way we work, and our workspaces are designed to support our well-being, offer career advancement opportunities, and enable us to be at our best.


**Why should you join Philips?**


Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions. Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year. Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for. Even you.


Visit our careers website to explore what it’s like working at Philips, read stories from our employee blog, find information about our recruitment process and answers to some frequently asked questions.

*It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person’s relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.*

*As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.*

*Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran*

title: Design for Reliability Director
description:
### **Job Title**


Design for Reliability Director### **Job Description**

**Design for Reliability Director**


You will be leading the efforts for ensuring the reliability and robustness of our Image-Guided Therapy Systems used in cardiac or vascular medical diagnosis and treatment. Your role will be pivotal in developing and integrating the DFR mindset into the design process to create products that meet the highest standards of performance, safety, and reliability, ultimately improving patient outcomes and enhancing the efficiency of healthcare delivery.

**Your role:**

* Strategic Leadership, Team Management & Cross-Functional Collaboration: Develop and execute strategies to embed DFR principles into the design and development process of IGT-S systems, aligning with overall business objectives. Lead and mentor a multidisciplinary team of reliability/design/test engineers and analysts, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement. Collaborate closely with R&D, product management, quality assurance, and other stakeholders to integrate reliability considerations throughout the product lifecycle including the design and manufacturing phases.
* Risk Assessment, Mitigation & Reliability Testing: Identify and assess potential failure modes and risks associated with product design and implement proactive measures to mitigate these risks. Oversee the development and execution of comprehensive reliability testing protocols, including accelerated life testing, stress testing, and failure mode analysis.
* Data Analysis / Insights & Regulatory Compliance: Utilize data analytics and predictive modelling techniques to extract insights from reliability testing results and drive data-driven decision-making. Ensure compliance with relevant regulatory standards and requirements pertaining to product reliability and safety.
* Continuous Improvement: Establish metrics and KPIs to measure the effectiveness of DFR initiatives and drive continuous improvement efforts to enhance product reliability and performance.
* Knowledge Sharing and Training: Promote knowledge sharing and provide training to the organization on best practices in reliability engineering and design for reliability.

**You're the right fit if:**

* You’ve acquired 15+ years experience in product development and implementing DFR principles within FDA regulated medical device (ISO 13485) or other highly regulated industries and a minimum of 5+ years in strategic program and/or functional leadership
* Your skills include expertise/detailed knowledge of reliability engineering tools and methodologies, including Fault Tree Analysis (FTA), Highly Accelerated Limit Testing (HALT), Accelerated Life Testing (ALT), Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA/FMEA), Root Cause Analysis (RCA), Mean Time Between Failure (MTBF), Mean Time to Failure (MTTF), Environmental Testing and Design for Reliability (DfR)
* You have an advanced degree in Engineering or other technical discipline and experience in Data Analysis, utilizing the ReliaSoft Suite of tools or similar tools.
* You’re a proven leader of reliability engineering teams and driving reliability initiatives in a complex technical environment, preferably within the medical device or healthcare industry
* Travel up to 30%.

**About Philips**


We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.
* Read more about our employee benefits.


If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.


#LI-EU

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Job ID:** R0008371


**Date posted:** 02/09/2024


**Company description**  

You see things a little differently. So do we! We believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us.  

  

Who we are The world is changing, and the IKEA business is changing with it. For IKEA though, one thing will always remain the same our vision to create a better everyday life for the many people.  

  

We will strengthen and develop our competencies to meet the needs and dreams of the many people around the world. And to be accessible and relevant, wherever and whenever they wish to meet IKEA.  

  

**About IKEA Insights**  

Insights has the assignment to contribute to IKEA people making well-founded decisions based on actionable and timely insights. Insights delivers Retail Insights, Product Range and Communication Insights, and Strategy Insights. Each of these three areas develops and/or operates insight products to IKEA people across our value chain.  

  

As a Data Scientist, you will be part of the Data Engineering and Analytics chapter while working in a cross-functional team with one of the products within IKEA Insights.

 **Job description** ***Being a Data Scientist in the INSIGHTS team***


As a Data Scientist in the Insights team, you will be responsible for analysing large amounts of data and creating predictive models to help us understand and influence customer behaviour and preferences. You will work closely together with other Data scientists, Data engineers, Product team(s) and other stakeholders. You will be part of creating solutions that enable customers to design any space in their homes and businesses and configure home furnishing solutions digitally. Exploring and utilizing different technologies and approaches to achieve the best result is a natural part of everything you do. With your data driven mindset you are a strong ambassador and driver for the data literacy and culture in IKEA Insights.

 ***To be successful in this role***


You are passionate about using data to analyse and develop dashboards and models that help our customers find the home furnishing solutions that best fit their needs.


You bring broad knowledge of modern applied algorithms (predictive and prescriptive) for extracting insights and making decisions based on data, a strength in statistics and general analytical knowledge. You make mistakes sometimes that keep you evolving and learning as you are not afraid to find new ways to solve a challenging task together with your colleagues.  

  

You have a great interest in the world around you and keep yourself updated with the latest trends and future technology, just as we do.  



***To be successful in this role, the following knowledge, skills and experiences would be valuable:***

* Minimum Master's degree in statistics, physics, mathematics, econometrics, computer science or related
* Comprehensive understanding of statistical and machine learning techniques
* Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
* Proficiency with an appropriate set of languages, technologies, and frameworks (e.g., Python, PySpark, Databricks, Azure ML, ADLS, MLFlow, Github) and cloud environments (e.g. Azure)
* Proficiency with data modelling techniques and concepts, CI/CD
* Preferably minimum 5 years’ experience in equal or comparable position
* Experience from the business that the product area (data) is supporting and enabling
* Experience as a project member in agile project environments and methodologies as well as in running business activities
* Ability to collaborate with others (including virtual) such as team members, stakeholders and suppliers to achieve goals, pro-active attitude
* Ability to explain statistical and machine learning techniques to non-technical stakeholders and software engineers
* Work with technology as a business tool and translate requirements into solutions, balancing user experience, business needs and IT constraints
* Ability to understand the complexity of the IKEA business and the role of technology as an integrated part of the business

 ***You will also:***

* Facilitate the construction of transparent, reproducible, reusable and generalisable data science products and services
* Research and develop models for data analysis
* Design, develop and maintain data science models and infrastructures, for your area or product.
* Communicate results and ideas to key decision makers
* Contribute to the dissemination of methodologies, accelerators or algorithms created for specific models or analysis
* Make sure that the insights and conclusions from data science are easily available to other parts of the organisation
* Support a culture of data-driven decision making across IKEA organisations
* Continuously improve existing models and environments
* Work closely together with data engineers, architects, analysts, peers, and other relevant roles across IKEA as well as in your team
* Ensure application and consistency with relevant digital frameworks, principles, guidelines, and standards
* Document and make the operational know-how of the data science models available to the IKEA ecosystem
* Keep up to date with the latest technology trends
* Assure quality and contribute to testing of deliverables

 **Qualification**  

* Bachelor’s degree within Engineering, Computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related fields. Master’s degree is preferred within Engineering, Computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related fields.
* Minimum of 5+ years of experience in a similar role working in running business activities as well as in agile project environments.
* Strong Communication skills. Written & verbal in English

  

**More Information**  

This role is full-time (32 - 40 hours per week) and can be based in Delft, Netherlands. Please send us your application (CV and motivation letter in English) on or before Friday 20th September 2024.  

  

Please note that we always recruit based on values, competence, your potential and diversity.

title: Data Scientist II- Insights
description:
Role Description:
**Key Responsibilities*** Responsible for owning the design and delivery of entire Data Science solutions based on business requirements, bringing them from the initial idea-generation phase to implementation independently.
* Responsible for working autonomously on consuming data, preparing it for data science use, translating business problems to data stories and solving them effectively by applying suitable statistical data analysis and modeling methods. Leverages input from business stakeholders in all of the above to determine the right technical solutions to deliver customer value.
* Responsible for working primarily within the scope of their team to deliver work that informs business decisions for the product / business topic they currently work on, occasionally collaborating across multiple teams.
* Responsible for designing and interpreting quantitative experiments to objectively guide key business decision making.
* Responsible for independently identifying and managing stakeholders in operational, project-based, and managerial roles. Effectively communicates, addresses stakeholder needs, and conveys complex analysis results in a clear manner. Begins to guide junior colleagues in stakeholder engagement.
* Responsible for being flexible in adopting existing internal and external Data Science approaches, proposing and spotting opportunities to apply new approaches and expanding their technical competencies and their peer's when a more efficient way presents itself.
* Responsible for leveraging Data Science for impact while learning to incorporate scalability, reproducibility and long term orientation in their work.
* Responsible for acting as a force multiplier for junior peers in the team by actively helping them with their craft through means of coaching, mentoring and setting a good example.
* Responsible for contributing to the community of their area by supporting community projects aimed at making other data professional more effective, actively participating in community strengthening activities (ie. recruitment) and connecting with peers beyond their area.
* Must be knowledgeable about the larger data ecosystem at Booking and how it relates to the work they do.
* Responsible for collaborating with peers in related crafts (ie. Data Engineering), anticipating data needs to ensure smooth progress of their individual projects.
* Must be knowledgeable with the operational, tactical and strategic goals of their area (ie. track / vertical) and have high level knowledge of the goals of their wider area (ie. Business Unit).
* Responsible for ensuring quality of their own work by validating it through peer review.
* Responsible for influencing business decisions within their specific area (ie. product team).

title: Analytical Development Chemist
description:
**Work Schedule**


Other**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**


The Analytical Development Chemist (Scientist 1, Research and Development) is a crucial role supporting the expansion of the Analytical Development (AD) Team and the R&D Organization within Drug Product Development - Europe.


This is a mid-level technical role reporting to the Analytical Development Supervisor. This role also includes responsibilities as core team member that is actively involved in multifunctional project teams that support the growth of Thermo Fisher’s internal product pipeline, external client-based product development, and technical support for on-site operations. This is an excellent opportunity for scientific professionals with experience developing and validating analytical methods within a GMP/GLP environment.

  

The role plays an essential role the product and technology innovation strategy by leading, executing, and supporting all analytical development activities (method development, validation, stability, data interpretation, problem solving). You will perform laboratory tasks in accordance with applicable procedures and good documentation practices in compliance with GMP requirements. Knowledge of relevant regulatory guidelines can be a benefit. You will work with analytical scientists of various levels and will represent the AD team in various internal and client development projects in all phases of development cycle. The role will be able to continuously improve your customer-facing skills by understanding the voice of the client in the development project teams.

**What will you do?**

*Represent the AD team as core team member in projects to present and discuss solutions for clients and in-house development projects with authority to make decisions on timeline, execution and define the strategy of AD-related activities and results. In addition, you will also coordinate/complete sample testing activities and assist your fellow scientists on performing laboratory benchwork and data analysis to meet project timelines.*

*Work closely within the R&D matrix organization, collaboration with multiple departments such as project management, formulation, regulatory affairs, process technology and scale-up and validation.*

*Perform method assessment and establishment activities with senior scientists that includes activities for phase appropriate validation, initial stability assessment for early formulation work, and FDS.*

*Find the best scientific strategy to characterize the quality, safety, and efficacy of our products.*

*Telling the story to drive decision-making: present scenarios and recommendations by ensuring that all analytical activities are focused on answering questions that lead to better decisions and high-quality products for our internal and external clients.*

*Liaises with internal scientific, analytical, and laboratory functional areas to meet project and team objectives.*

*Perform all duties in compliance with Standard Operating Procedures, Good Manufacturing Practices, Good Laboratory Practices and Safety guidelines.*

*Collaborate with peers and perform laboratory activities for analytical method development, validation, and transfers.*

**How will you get here?**


Bachelor of Science or Master’s degree in chemistry, biochemistry or related physical science. Advanced degree preferred.


Typically requires experience (2+ years) working in the pharmaceutical industry, preferably in development. Equivalent combinations of education, training, and relevant work experience may be considered.


Preferably skilled in various analytical techniques (e.g. (U)HPLC) to conduct analysis for stability studies, release of products, and R&D activities


A passion for the use of scientific methodology in enabling method development strategies and solving problems.


Demonstrable knowledge of subject matter(s) related to analytical method development and validation, along with a sound understanding of principles and concepts in other relevant subject areas.


Able to shepherd projects with medium complexity to completion by getting help from others as an individual leader and contributor.


Ability to optimally determine goals, priorities and time required. Can indicate courses of action, required resources, bring up potential issues, and make adjustments as needed to achieve particular goals.


A person who enjoys working in a team, embraces the sophisticated challenges that are related to product development discover satisfaction in this role.


Diversity in our teams is an important element to create an effective and challenging working environment. Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement are key characteristics that we expect of all that are part of our community.


Anyone that is already challenged by this position or first would like to know more about it is highly encouraged to respond to this vacancy. This will enable us and you to find out whether you might be the colleague that we are looking for and providing you the opportunity to grow and develop yourself with your contribution in our mission to serve our customers.

**We offer**


Excellent career opportunities within a large and growing global employer.


Competitive salary.


Annual Incentive Plan (bonus).


Generous benefits package.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Senior Process Development Scientist
description:
**At Corbion, we exist to champion preservation in all its forms, preserving food and food production, health, and our planet.**

  

As a Senior Process Development Scientist you will be improving and developing innovative new downstream (bio)chemical processes as part of the Process Technology department of Corbion’s Innovation Center, at our location in Gorinchem. This is the largest R&D site of Corbion with labs, offices, and a pilot plant, supporting manufacturing facilities worldwide.


Corbion Innovation Center’s Process Technology department is a team of around 20 scientists and technicians. We create value by providing innovative solutions for process design, development and optimization activities and taking responsibility for scale-up and process demonstration, from bench-top to industrial scale, including technology transfer and implementation support.

 **The Role**

  

As a Senior Process Development Scientist, you collaborate and lead technical activities to develop, scale-up and transfer processes and know-how between R&D and Operations. You combine a solid scientific background with a hands-on approach and drive to deliver. You are familiar with working in innovative, multi-disciplinary project teams, forming and maintaining connections to business and operations as well as colleagues from other Innovation Center groups (Industrial Fermentation, Product Development, Microbiology, etc.

  

* Leading and supporting process development, scale-up, implementation and optimization of new or existing processes and products at Corbion's locations or at third parties.
* Troubleshooting of production by adequately translating the technology challenges to lab, pilot scale and production scale trials.
* Preparing, leading, and executing pilot and demo-scale production runs.
* Analyzing results and providing data based recommendations to stakeholders.
* Ensuring documentation and reporting of procedures and results according to Corbion standards.
* Supporting intellectual property, regulatory affairs, marketing, and sales departments with relevant expertise, including signaling IP opportunities.
* Building insight, know-how and skills on different downstream processing technologies for both food and non-food products.
* Assisting in development and mentoring of junior specialists, technicians.
 **In this role, you will be travelling worldwide up to 30%, mostly to Thailand & Brazil. This is mandatory. Travelling will also depend on the project you will be working on.**

 **About you**

  

* Educational background at the M.Sc or Ph.D. level in a relevant discipline e.g. (bio) chemical engineering, food technology or relevant studies.
* Theoretical background and a couple of years' experience in development, scale-up and implementation of specific unit operations used in downstream processing.
* Experience with innovation projects, preferably experience with coordinating R&D project teams in a multi-functional project environment.
* Willingness and able to work in an operations environment as well as R&D.
* Translated cases between R&D, engineering and operations.
* Contribute to identify potential safety risks when preparing lab/pilot and production trials.
* Affinity in bringing science and innovation to production environments, by combining critical thinking, process know-how, and a pragmatic mindset.
* Fluency in English (oral and written).

 **About Corbion**

  

Corbion is the global market leader in lactic acid and its derivatives, and a leading supplier of emulsifiers, functional enzyme blends, minerals, vitamins, and algae ingredients. We use our unique expertise in fermentation and other processes to deliver sustainable solutions for the preservation of food and food production, health, and our planet. For over 100 years, we have been uncompromising in our commitment to safety, quality, innovation and performance. Drawing on our deep application and product knowledge, we work side-by-side with customers to make our cutting-edge technologies work for them. Our solutions help differentiate products in markets such as food, home & personal care, animal nutrition, pharmaceuticals, medical devices, and bioplastics. In 2023, Corbion generated annual sales of €1,443.8 million and had a workforce of 2,727 FTE. Corbion is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. For more information: www.corbion.com

 ***Corbion does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers. All candidates must be submitted by approved Corbion vendors who have been expressly requested to make a submission by our Talent Acquisition team for a specific job opening. No placement fees will be paid to any firm unless such a request has been made by the Corbion Talent Acquisition team and such candidate was submitted to the Corbion Talent Acquisition Team.***

title: MS Dynamics 365
description:
**Location:** Amsterdam (Hybrid 2 days onsite)
  

**Languages:** English
  

**Employment Type:** Employee
  

**Start Date:** ASAP
  

  

**Context o** **f the mission/Objective(s) of the job:**  

We are seeking a skilled **Microsoft Dynamics CRM Technical Developer** with a strong background in developing and implementing CRM solutions using Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform.
  

  

**Responsibilities.**  

* Develop and customize Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions, including custom plugins, PCF controls, and model-driven apps.
* Implement complex business logic using C#, .NET, and PowerApps Component Framework (PCF).
* Create and maintain custom user interfaces using ReactJS, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS.
* Work with Microsoft Dataverse (CDS) for data management and integration.
* Develop and automate workflows and processes using Power Automate.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment to design, develop, and implement new features.
* Utilize DevOps practices for continuous integration and deployment.
* Provide technical guidance and support to other team members and stakeholders.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues in a timely manner.

  

**Requirements.**  

* **Microsoft Dynamics CRM Technical:** Deep understanding of Dynamics 365 CRM architecture and customization.
* **Plugins (C#, .Net):** Strong experience in developing custom plugins using C# and .NET.
* **PowerApps Component Framework (PCF):** **Proficient in developing custom components using ReactJS, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS.**
* **JavaScript:** **Advanced proficiency in JavaScript for custom scripts and UI enhancements.**
* **Microsoft Dataverse (CDS):** **Experience with data modeling and integration using Dataverse.**
* **Power Automate:** **Experience in automating workflows and business processes** **.**
* **Model-Driven Apps:** **Expertise in developing and customizing model-driven apps within the Power Platform.**
* **Agile & DevOps:** **Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices for CI/CD pipelines.**
* **ReactJS:** **Strong skills in developing responsive and interactive user interfaces.**
* **Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM Technical:** **In-depth technical knowledge of the Dynamics 365 CRM platform.**
* **PySpark:** **Experience with PySpark for data processing and analytics is a plus.**

title: Operational Logistics Advisor (FO)
description:
**MSF is an international, independent medical humanitarian organization. We are a non-profit, self-governed****worldwide movement of more than 63,000 people.**  


**We provide emergency medical** **assistance** **during armed conflict, natural disasters, outbreaks of deadly diseases****and** **assist** **those who are excluded from healthcare. MSF delivers care based on need and when we see** **injustice, we** **speak out. We are an organization that** **remains** **impartial, knowledgeable, and effective, and this is what****makes the difference between life and death.**  


**People are our priority. At Médecins Sans** **Frontières** **(MSF)/** **Artsen****zonder****Grenzen****, we are committed to an****inclusive culture that encourages and supports the diverse voices of our employees. We****encourage diverse****applicants including individuals of all gender identities, ages, sexual orientations, nationalities, races,** **religions, beliefs****, social and marital status, people with different abilities and all other** **diversity** **abilities****.**  


With immediate effect, our Logistics department is looking for an:  


**Operational Logistics Advisor** **(****F****O****)**

*(**Based in Amsterdam**)*  

As an FO, you serve as the functional manager for the Logistics Coordinators in the country programs and at HQ level you work as part of a cross-matrix team. The FO represents Logistics as a part of the Operational Support Team (OST) managed by an Operational Manager. The FO responsibilities include fostering strong relationships with country programs, understanding field operations and the role of Logistics support, and organizing necessary specialist support from the Field Support Unit (FSU). The FO ensures the adaptation of policies and procedures to local contexts while providing guidance to maintain acceptable standards of logistics, safety and technical support. An FO validates HQ trip reports and ensure the alignment between field support with HQ operations. Your tasks involve developing and implementing mission-specific logistics strategies, offering expert advice, and mentoring Logistics Coordinators. Additionally, you work closely with other team members and international partners to align strategies and contribute to the development of new tools and policies. Regular and timely field visits and potential gap-fill for Logistics Coordinators are also expected.  


As this role is based in Amsterdam, the ideal candidate should either already be based in The Netherlands or willing to re-locate to The Netherlands.  


**Main** **responsibilities**



* You are the focal point for Logistics Coordinators in assigned country programs, as well as the single point of contact for the Operations Manager, regarding logistics. You maintain an effective relationship with the missions you are assigned to, you are aware of the challenges in the field, and you organise the support to fulfil those needs. You keep yourself informed about development in the logistics/ technical area, inside and outside MSF.
* You steer and guide the tailoring of general policies, strategies, procedures and guidelines to the local situation. You provide advice and ensure the responsiveness, agility, quality, efficiency, and availability of logistics/technical support.
* You monitor the quality of the logistic processes and results in the country programs and ensure the appropriate level is attained.
* You validate all HQ trips reports and recommendations related to the field logistics in assigned portfolio.
* You work closely together with the other OST team members, securing alignment of all actions and keeping an overview.
* You represent Operations / Country Missions in the Logistics department, and Logistics department in Operations. You assure that HQ input and involvement in field support is well organized, functioning and aligned, and that, as a consequence, HQ speaks with “one voice”.
* You are expected to spend significant time in the field and replace LogCos when required.

  


**Specific tasks**



* Vision of Logistics within assigned portfolio of countries in regard to mission Operational & Technical Logistics / Supply Chain strategy, Missions specific Logistics policy framework: validation, development, implementation and compliance in collaboration with CMT and Log dept
* Mission specific expert advice including sharing of best practices, including transversal topics e.g., vaccination, NFI’s etc.
* Validation/ support in development and implementation of mission-specific policies, logistical strategies/ tactical approaches, support structuresand service level definition, in the area of logistics, made specific to the mission
* Coaching and mentoring of LogCo’s
* Advice to Operations regarding logistics, including proposed course of action in crisis situations
* Alignment of strategy and services with counterparts in other MSF sections and international organizations.
* Contribution to the development of new tools, equipment and/ or policies
* Reports and expert advice and enable decision making on Applied security, Air Operations, Technical Logistics and Supply chain management.
* Validation of all HQ trips reports and recommendations related to the field logistics in assigned portfolio.
* Expert advice and guidance on transversal operational logistics themes and / or topics.

  


**Candidate Profile**

* Higher vocational/ BSc/ MSc in (an area related to) Logistics.
* **Current or** **previous** **MSF experience of 5-7 years' experience as Logistics Coordinator or Head of Mission in the field (>5** **missions in positions like Log team Leader, Log/Admin, Deputy** **LogCo****, All-round Log)****.**
* In-depth knowledge of the domains within logistics (including technical logistics (biomedical, IT, construction), SC management, air operations, operational logistics, water and sanitation).
* Strong data literacy skills, including proficiency in tools like Excel and Power BI for data analysis and visualization is a strong asset.
* Excellent communication skills in **English** **& French** (written and spoken) are essential.
* You are willing to travel up to 40% of the time for annual field visits, short-term gap-fills and emergencies.

  


**C****o****mpetenc****ies**

* Results and quality orientation
* Planning and Organizing
* People Management and Development
* Initiative and Innovation

  


**We offer**  


A full-time appointment (based on a 40-hours workweek) for one year with renewal option based on satisfactory performance appraisal.  


A gross monthly salary in scale 16 with a current salary range between € 4,085-5,624 gross per month. The exact salary depends on relevant work experience.  


Other benefits:

* 30 paid vacation days annually, contingent upon full-time employment status.
* A premium free pension where MSF covers 100% of the monthly pension contribution
* 8% holiday allowance, paid out with the salary once a year in May
* Commuting allowance (terms and conditions apply) & work from home allowance
* Hybrid working option
* L&D will support you with a variety of learning and development opportunities with internal and external trainings and courses
* Discounted daily lunch at the office
* An environment that fosters diversity, with colleagues from around the world representing various cultures and background

  


**Application**

If you recognise yourself in this profile, we welcome you to apply directly via our website and upload a ***letter of motivation + Curriculum Vitae*** **(in English) as one combined document.**  


The closing date for applications is**22****September 2024** at 23:59 CET.  


**Information**

For more information about the recruitment procedure, please contact Recruiter, Ali Hamdan – ali.hamdan@amsterdam.msf.org  


**\*\*\*****No agencies please****\*\*\***

title: Researcher Fermentation Technology
description:
**Great Job**
-------------


MNEXT forms the bridge between innovation and society together with SMEs. More than 80 employees work at MNEXT (including teacher-researchers from various Avans and HZ courses). In addition, 7 research groups are part of MNEXT: Biobased Construction (both at HZ and Avans), Biobased Resources & Energy, Biobased Building Blocks & Products , Smart Energy, Renewable Energy Carriers, Biobased Transitions and Marine Biobased Chemistry.


Precision fermentation is one of the key technologies in the material transition. To reinforce the development of fermentation research, we are seeking a skilled Systems Modeler with extensive experience in fermentation processes to join our team on a contractual basis. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in systems modelling, bioprocess engineering, and data analysis, and will contribute to the optimization and development of our fermentation processes.


**As a researcher, we envision you to:**
----------------------------------------

* Develop and implement systems models for fermentation processes.
* Analyze and interpret data from fermentation experiments to refine and validate models.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate modelling results into process development.
* Optimize fermentation parameters to improve yield, efficiency, and scalability.
* Prepare detailed technical reports and presentations on modelling outcomes and recommendations.
* Translate your theoretical and technical expertise into practical protocols for broader users, this includes junior technicians and commercial partners.
* Guide internship students with existing/new research projects.
* Participate in existing research projects, conduct research and/or project management tasks.
* Organize meetings with professors and associate professors, researchers, project leaders about possible new projects and lead in funding applications.
* Interact with Avans bachelor and master programs by providing work fields advices, guest lectures and student project ideas.


**Your place as a researcher within Avans**  

The research group is situated within the Center of Expertise MNEXT, a joint undertaking of Avans University of Applied Science and HZ University of Applied Sciences. By conducting applied research with students, teachers, researchers and outside stakeholders, we set the materials and energy transition in motion towards a more sustainable future. The research group is new which means there is ample scope to show initiative and explore new ideas.  

  

*More information about MNEXT's activities can be found on the* *website* *.*


**We offer you**
----------------


An environment where you have the freedom to discover and improve things; This is how we get the best out of you. We facilitate you in your continuous development, with which you then contribute to our further professional and technical professionalization. We also offer you:


* A monthly salary of a minimum of € 4.361 to a maximum of € 6.144 gross for a full-time contract (scale 11 collective labor agreement for higher professional education).
* A year-end bonus, roughly equal to a 13th month.
* An contract for 1 year. If the position functions well and there is sufficient training space, an extension is a possibility.
* A good work-life balance and pleasant workplaces.
* A lot of freedom in your job with the option to work from home.

**You fit right in**
--------------------


As an researcher, you participate in research projects and show others the value of your ideas. You have a great affinity with the interaction between research, education and the professional field and you are enthusiastic about student participation in research. You have experience in guiding internship students and interest in research-education integration. With your strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data sets you demonstrate excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail. Avans' vision on applied research appeals to you. You can put things into perspective, are stress-resistant and 'fit' in with the informal and professional atmosphere of Avans University of Applied Sciences. Affinity to or interests in data driven methods such as oxford nanopore sequencing and bioinformatics experience would be a plus. Furthermore you have:


* A master’s degree or higher in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Systems Biology, or a related field.
* Proven experience in systems modelling specifically for fermentation processes.
* Proficiency in modelling software and tools (e.g., MATLAB, R, Aspen Plus, COMSOL).
* Proficiency in programming skills like Python and R.
* Excellent writing and communication skills in English, preferably also Dutch.

**Innovative Avans**
--------------------


Large, but small-scale. Concerned. Personal. That's Avans. Here you can be yourself. We will give you all the space you need with your unique ideas and insights. That suits our learning and enterprising character. We offer optimally flexible education and research in co-creation with the professional field. And we continuously change with the world around us. We want to offer more and more tailor-made solutions, where students partly determine their own learning path. That is our Ambition for 2025. Discover Avans as an employer through these stories.


**Contribute to our research**
------------------------------


Do you see a great role for yourself in further professionalizing our education and research and in contributing to the further development of Avans into a knowledge institution? Please apply no later than 20th September 2024 via the application button. If you have any questions about the content of the position, please contact Miaomiao Zhou, Associate Professor Smart fermentation, via m.zhou1@avans.nl / 088-5256361. Within 2 weeks after closing the vacancy we update you on your application.


*We find our candidates ourselves, therefore we do not deal with acquisition.*

title: Junior Data Analyst
Ecommerce Product and Performance Engineer
description:
**Values & Innovation**
-----------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values - Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality - serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further - no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state-of-the-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------


Equal parts data scientist, data engineer, and storyteller, the Ecommerce Product and Performance Engineer will construct and manage the KPIs that guide the elements of the European Ecommerce sites.

  

As the Product and Performance Engineer, you will work with our product and analytics teams to develop the metrics that the business will use to measure success and provide the means for key stakeholders to access those metrics through reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.

  

Being the subject matter expert on the data produced and collected relative to the website functions, you will provide the intelligence necessary to extract insights from that data, recognize where data needs are unmet and must be enhanced, and will facilitate the necessary connections to ensure stakeholder visibility and understanding.

  

You will write analytics tagging business requirements for improved tracking as well as new features. You will support the analytics and business teams to measure the visitor experience and the platform and governance engineers to understand the impact of their changes on those measurements.

  

You will troubleshoot processes to prevent tagging issues and improve time-to-resolve for issues that do arise. The ability to write and follow process workflows and create clear documentation are important in this role. This role must be knowledgeable in AA administration of classification rules, processing rules, data feeds/sources, and design of custom variables.

**Your Impact**
---------------

* Support an upcoming platform switch to understand performative results and the impact of key enhancements:
	+ Develop and maintain innovative KPI dashboards for all EMEA owned and operated sites.
	+ Analyse site and KPI performance utilizing multiple analytics systems (included but not limited to Adobe, Qualtrics, Quantum Metric)
	+ Support the business understanding of the results and impact of key initiatives.
	+ Deliver complete and thorough results summary by closely collaborating with the Analytics and technical teams and by understanding the ecommerce performance and up to date business trends.
* Investigate data anomalies/discrepancies to determine their sources and implications. Where needed, formulate change requests to resolve issues and ensure better data accuracy and consistency.
* Ensure data governance.
* Collaborate on the development of the product roadmap and evaluate the return on investment.
	+ Define revenue and KPI opportunities and return on investment for new potential features.
	+ Work with cross-functional teams to develop data driven insights pertinent to user behavior and formulate actionable recommendations to increase conversion or enhance customer experience.
* Assist with the development of A/B testing opportunities.
* General analysis of qualitative and quantitative metrics to detect and give actionable insights to improve our ecommerce site and digital products.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* Proficient at SQL
* Proficient scripting (Python), statistical packages (R, SciPy)
* Deep experience with Analytics tools (Adobe Analytics, Qualtrics, Quantum Metric, Snowflake or similar).
* Previous experience with tag managers like Tealium and Adobe Launch
* Experience with front-end development and Javascript, CSS
* Ability to perform and document beacon tests using Adobe Analytics Debugger, Fiddler, Omnibug, or similar tools.
* Experience in BI tools & Visualization (Tableau, SAP BI, PowerBi or similar).
* Ability to excel in a fast-paced team environment, adapt to shifting urgencies, manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
* Deep understanding of online consumer and purchase behavior. Experience in Sport or Fashion industry is a plus.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and effective communication.
* Fluent English spoken and written.
* Experience with ETL tools (Tableau Prep) is a plus.

  

#LI-SB2

**Workplace Location**
----------------------

* **Location:** This individual must reside within commuting distance from our Amsterdam **o**ffice.
* **Return to Work Designation:** Hybrid work (baseline of minimum 2 days a week in-office.
**Relocation**
--------------

* No relocation provided
**Benefits & Perks**
--------------------

* Paid “UA Give Back” Volunteer Days: Work alongside your team to support initiatives in your local community.
* Under Armour Merchandise Discounts
* Health & fitness benefits, discounts and resources- We offer teammates across the country programs to promote physical activity and overall well-being.
* 38 hour working week
* Hybrid work, a minimum of 2 days in the office
* 28 days holiday
* Teammate Resource groups e.g. Green Machine, Sustainability, LGBTQIA+, Women in Leading and Living, Balance for mental health and wellbeing etc.
* Human Performance Institute (Gym) on site
* Local Language course when moving from abroad
**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.
